3.description: We ordered our food from grub hub on Friday March 6th, after 2 hours I called to check the status of delivery and a women told me the driver had been here. I was starving and on high alert for my food and no bells or phone calls were missed. After going back and forth it was discovered that the driver actually called the wrong number multiple times even though the correct number was in the delivery instructions. At this point the women offers no apology and has an attitude and says do u want your food or not. It was 10:40pm, I placed my order at 8:20. Of course I want my food cause everyone else was closed and I was hungry. (Hints why I ordered food in the first place) the women offered no compensation and still no apology. The 2nd driver comes to deliver the food. He calls the correct number and tells my boyfriend to come to his car....... Excuse me. Why would anyone walk outside of their home to a car to pick up food. So my boyfriends tells him that he will meet him at the door. The driver then starts to holler at him until finally my boyfriend says "look Im coming downstairs to the door and u have to walk to the door and that's the end of it". I look out the window to see the driver has parked down the street (even thought there was a park in front) he walks up and doesn't look at the address and proceeds to turn around back to the car. Since I was looking out the window I jollared out to tell him the right door. He then has a complete attitude with my boyfriend and tells him well next time don't order. Is that how I should be treated over some food that I already paid for by credit card over the food. Simply terrible service. The fried rice. wasn't bad except since it took 2 hours it was like warm and the wings were soft.  I will never order from them again.

1.description: Believe the other reviewers.

2.description: So far no problems with this place. Food is cooked fresh, only thing they are cheap about is charging for one hot sauce. Other then that keep it up! I seen the other issues about delivery issues. For the area of location I highly doubt anyone tips. As being the driving I wouldn't go an extra mile for the customer.

5.description: Statement from the White delivery driver, "I am not bringing the food up to your office because "you people" don't tip!Yes, really.  Last week, I ordered $75 worth of food for a meeting and asked it to be delivered to the meeting location. I received a call from the delivery driver letting me know that I needed to come outside to his car to get the food. I let him know the room number and he stated that he was not coming up because "you people " don't tip! Ok, as you are referencing a primarily Black institution and speaking to a woman of color, I definitely take offense to that.I came downstairs and called the owner on the phone (Lilly?). There was no apology or anything... Just them arguing back and forth. The driver then shoved the bags in my hands and told me he was in college and didn't need this job. A few hours later, the driver began harassing me on my cell phone through text messages. Sigh... Block and tIme to cancel the credit card I used. Also, all of the items I ordered were not in the bag!I have placed several orders here but I promise you that this one was the very last!

6.description: WARNING! I repeat. WARNING! It took 2hrs for my order to be delivered. Apart from being cold the food was not tasty. No flavor and beef had weird texture. Never again. It was the first and last for me.

7.description: i've only ordered twice and both times were pretty bad.. the first time my sesame chicken arrived at my house, dried out, and old... it was very bad..also the delivery driver is late and filled with lame excuses. this second time, well i'm eating it now and my stomach is hurting from the mystery shrimp. also the food was very very cold and late... took over an hour and a half... i ordered with grubhub and paid with paypay... because of the terrible service i asked grubhub to retract my tip... the delivery guy just makes excuses that are clearly lies. and when i called him out he got an attitude and made up some more lies and the restaurant refused to take any fault when grubhub called them to tell them what happened!!! just dont order from this place... i would have given NO STARS if that was an option :(

0.description: Decided to get take out from here recently and used one of the online sites to order (and avoid a wait).I get there about 10 minutes after the time they suggested...waited for the cashier....who said she just got my order as the system is running slow.So I waited...about 20 min later she comes out and give me the total which was $6 more than what I saw online...it was then that I saw she had the wrong order.  I pointed out what I wanted to order from my online confirmation.  About 5 minutes later, she came out with the correct order.I will say the food wasn't too bad so that made up for the experience (a little)...but bottom line, next time I'll either call it in or order at the place itself....

4.description: Food was disgusting and it took them nearly 2hrs to delivered to me i dont recommend this place

1.description: They don't deserve any stars. Ghetto as hell. And highly unprofessional. I drove in the drive thru area to spend over 30$ worth of food and when i got there, a women with no teeth commanded me to roll down my window as if she had an attitude. She then stated that she didn't have the food i requested and when i tried to change my order she rolled her eyes. I mean i didn't tell her to work at kfc, that old bat. So i said if theres a problem i could always go somewhere else and she stated in her own words. "Thats Fine With Me, It Wont Hurt Me None". Im like "TF" .. Steer clear of that place lbs..

0.description: After sitting at the drive thru at the Popeyes on 88th and Stony, only to be told chicken orders would be a 15 minute wait, I headed over to the KFC. I was greeted with a friendly order taker at the drive thru and was quickly presented with my order that was hot and fresh. There is clearly good management here who hires great staff. Thanks KFC for the pleasant experience.

1.description: Usually come here for the steak burritos, which are pretty good. Today stopped for the burrito pastor. Have to say it was Better than expected. The burrito was huge, and not with filler, the pork seasoning is tasty. Would recommend to anyone looking for a fast take out. Can't wait to try other menu offerings.

0.description: Man these tacos our huge with 2 tacos your set no need for anything else. Great place to eat and very fast service

58.description: Found this place courtesy of Mr. Anthony Bourdain. Ended up ordering a large amount of fried seafood and smoked shrimp which we consumed in a fairly rapid fashion in our automobile. Despite smelling like fish fry already, we proceed to order several pounds of smoked fish to take home in our long journey back to NY. While we luckily did not have any cats attacks our auto on the way, it was well worth the risk. Pros: Great smoked fish, shrimp, fairly inexpensiveCons: It is literally a shack in the middle of nowhere near the Illinois/ Indiana border. No tables, no restroom, nada

56.description: Wow. So, the bridge was up and we had time to kill so we decided to try this local legend out. So glad we did. We opted for the fried stuff because we were in the mood for it. The smelt and clams were amazing. Absolutely amazing. Definitely going back for the lemon pepper smoked fish. Fresh smoked fish on Fridays or Saturdays so plan accordingly. Honestly worth the short drive. Cash only but there's an atm there.

29.description: Great to go fish place, its just by the 95th street bridge, there's really only street parking so just be aware, (well there's a gravel lot just west, but idk if that's an actual parking lot) it's also real small and cramped inside, with just some picnic tables outside to sit at, but don't let that take away from the quality of the fish, it's a chicago staple, almost 70 years old, from the fried selection we got scallops, fish nuggets, calamari and stuffed shrimp, (scallops and shrimp were best imo) and then the smoked salmon, the smoked options are just more expensive so thats why we couldnt get much, tho it was def good, and then potato salad and french fries sides, which were standard, id for sure go back and try some of the more exotic fish on hand

42.description: We've been wanting to come here ever since seeing it on Anthony Bordain's show and it was great! I had the smoked salmon (very good) and fried catfish (excellent). It is a little pricy but the quality merits the price. 4 starts for a lot of not-homemade items like the coleslaw, potato salad, and sauces.I would happily go back!

23.description: This place is good!!! We got fried shrimp, smoked shrimp, fried oysters, fried scallops, and smoked salmon. My husband likes the fried shrimp, I'm not a big fried shrimp person so it as just okay to me! The fried oyster wasn't that good either, I think because it was kinda soggy I don't know. But like earlier reviews the smoked salmon and smoked shrimp is to die for! SERIOUSLY! It's that good! I want to try the black pepper and garlic smoked salmon now and other smoked stuff. The fried stuff is just okay but the smoked seafood here is where it's at!This place is just a little join on the side of the bridge. You order and you get out! But you need to try it, it's good!

47.description: Ordered the Catfish way too overpriced ( almost $13 for 4 grammar school lunch squares???!!) especially for the south side and I get Catfish briskets that were like the freezer kind that you get from the grocery store for like $2 a bag back in the 1990's and it tasted terrible! This is not fried fish it is Congolese torture! The fries were dry and unbelievably horrible! Complete and total ripoff! Avoid at all costs!!!!!

8.description: Yes and yes...I've made it to this place.  It has been a long wait for me.It was a bit difficult to trek all the way down from Albany Park during the winter season.  As I've announced publicly in one of my previous reviews, my "foodie hours" have been extended seasonally!  I had a quick nap in my hubby's work fleet, and I woke up with yummy fish and "smokin'" hotties in front of me.  You know fish can be just as hot as good-looking dudes or dudettes.  I consider them gender-free after being bathed in smoke.  Normally you would think a place like this that has won so many accolades from the big-foodie people (yeah I'm talking about Anthony Bourdain) wouldn't render a friendly service like I received this afternoon.  The young man immediately greeted us and was ready to take our order.  We chose the smoked shrimp dinner and fried fish dinner.  The total was $18.88 after tax.For a seafood fry place, the price we paid was reasonably fair.  Well, how were the tastes of our food?  I've never been that "moved" and "agitated" in my mind after tasting their smoked shrimps.  That 70-year-old smoker really is an excellent machine to deliver such aromatic smoke on these jumbo shrimps.  I believe I consumed five (5) or six (6) large, if not, jumbo shrimps.  Once again, the value for the quality of food I received wasn't a bad deal at all!  All dinner combos came with fries, coleslaw, crackers, a choice of sauce (hot or cocktail), and salt/pepper.  All other side dishes were solid.  Hubby also enjoyed his fish, but you all need to try other smoked products!  How many exclamation marks have I used in this review?  Well, here's one (1) more for you!  I also noticed that there are three (3) city of Chicago public trash cans in front of the Calumet Fisheries.  I guess that's where my taxation goes...my foodie trash.  We will be back when we do our summer weekend Metra trips around the far-end Chicago and nearby suburbs.  I know the Metra station isn't too awfully far away; I can walk as long as there is food to entice me!  There's an ATM onsite if you drop your cash in the river accidentally.

31.description: Great food and fast service. The fried shimps are to die for. I have neen going there for years and I was never disappointed.

34.description: It would be a 5 star review if it was food alone BUT the score got knocked down bc of the location (so far south), their cash only policy, and no place to eat (everyone in line at the same time also ate in their car).But we loved what we ordered:Fried scallops - the best and really hearty piecesCalamari - deliciousSmoked salmon with garlic and peppers - great flavorFried oysters - good to try but probably sticking with cold oysters

16.description: Awesome smoked salmon & smoked shrimps!!!Not a fan of their fried oysters, though! But overall, it was great food! :)

13.description: Remember this place when I was real young. My dad and his best friend next door neighbor and his son (my best friend), and my brothers and even mom, use to fish near here on Wolf Lake...fun times! Brought back memories! Best Fried shrimp that I have had in a long time! Just the right amount of breading and seasoning. Service is quick and food is always freshly hot. Be careful...parking just on the side of a busy road but worth it! During the summer time, it i nice place to just eat at the outdoor table and watch boats go by and view the river/lake! This place has been here for a long time and still doing it right! They are truly famous for their smoked fish...a must try! Many famous/television chefs have visited this spot and rave over it!

11.description: Worth driving out of your way for. Seriously. This was easily a half hour drive outside of Chicago, and I'd do it again. Smoked and fried fish aplenty, right on the water. It really doesn't get much better than this. If my endorsement isn't enough for you, the many awards on the walls should be. Anthony Bourdain is among their fans, too.Smoked is the way to go here. I'm sure their fried fish is fine, and the smelts we tried were tasty, but the smoked fish was by far the star of our meal. They sell by weight, so come hungry and plan to buy a couple of pounds to split with a group. There's some outdoor seating available or you can take it with you, but be sure to bring cash- I'm not a fan of cash-only businesses, but at least there's an ATM here.SMELTS: Grab a half order, available with a spicy or mild dipping sauce not unlike a buffalo wing sauce. They're hot and crispy, and plenty for sharing even with the half order. But I'd take these to go and make a garlic sauce to serve them with, as done in European cuisine.GARLIC PEPPER SMOKED SALMON: This was tasty, and by far the most recommended fish in the reviews. It was good, but not amazing. If your only knowledge of smoked fish is the lox on your bagel at a chain restaurant, you might really like this massive step up in quality.SMOKED TROUT: Go classic. The smoked trout is divine. No pepper or garlic needed, just simple, smoked fish. It's flavorful, with plenty of skin, and I could eat it for days.CRACKERS: Whatever you buy, grab a tube of crackers (they're 55 cents) to eat your fish with.  And don't forget to grab napkins, because you'll be eating all this tastiness with your hands.

39.description: great fesh fish no dine in but a chicago nessitity

37.description: I've been wanting to check out Calumet Fisheries FOREVER, so I was pretty excited to finally swing by!  This smokehouse has been family-owned and -operated by the Kotlick-Toll family since '48, where the fish is brined overnight and special oak logs are used for the smoking.  Fish, such as catfish, chubs, eel, rainbow trout, sable, salmon, sturgeon, white fish, and herring are some that are available.  They also have fried seafood (shrimp, fish, catfish, scallops, and crab cakes), as well as sides and salads.  I tried their Pepper & Garlic smoked salmon, a half order of the fried shrimp, and a half order of their fried smelts.  The smoked salmon was pretty good; just use a strong fork to flake it apart; they have packages of saltine crackers available, but you can bring you own.  It had a lovely smoked flavor, and the garlic and the peppercorn was not too overpowering.  Just having the fish with the crackers can be a little dry, so having some mayonnaise to spruce it up is a good idea.  The fried shrimp was forgettable, and the fried smelts were okay - the batter was more like ground cornmeal-like, rather than the crispy batter I was expecting.  Service was super friendly, and everything is made fresh-to-order (besides the smoked fish).  This is a cash only joint, so keep that in mind.  It is a carry-out only, but there are a couple of picnic tables in the front to enjoy your meal (I prefer to just chowing down in the car - that's how you do ittttttt) :P  I'd love to come back and try out their smoked sable, sturgeon, and the trout :D+Pepper & Garlic smoked salmon+friendly staff+cash only

0.description: Fantastic divey little fish stand on the far south side. Stellar smokey selection of pretty much anything that swims in the Great Lakes.  And somethings that don't.  I.e. my favorite: Smoked ShrimpBoating Tip: you can dock for free at Crowley's across the river and walk across the bridge.

38.description: Smoked shrimp and pepper garlic salmon was awesome.  Hard to find place but we'll worth the drive.

51.description: What can I say that hasn't already been said? Even my picky eater of a little sister thoroughly enjoyed the smoked trout, salmon, sturgeon and the fried shrimp. It's all great, delicious, high quality fish. Love this place. So worth the drive!

27.description: What do i say about a place that everything had been said. Gr8 food. Froglegs & smelt are a personal fav! Light breading, fast service. Place is a dump but who cares! Its got it baby! Ambience, the river & style! Cheap prices, i love them. Please go u wont be dissapointed! Its a chicago icon & a mom & pop place.  Shrimp is killer!

32.description: Cash only, does not take bills over 100, so I was extremely limited in what I could purchase w $10, so I got 1/2 order of fried shrimp, which was solid. Will have to come back soon for more...and with more cash.

54.description: Oh my, their smoked everything is awesome. The sable and sturgeon are more interesting but the good old fashioned smoked white fish and smoke salmon are still amazing. I also really liked the smoked shrimp!! I'm not that big into fried food bit the stuffed shrimp are really good. Everyone is friendly and easy to deal with. Small place so make your selections to keep things moving, no inside tables, quick service, cash only. So so good and wonderful to serve this smoked fish for Sunday morning brunch! Or a dinner appetizer! Or anytime!

48.description: I've just got back from Calumet Fisheries East 95th Chicago ILL.                        I ordered Stuffed Fried Shrimp/ Fried Frog Legs /Smoked Salmon/ Smoked Cat Fish/  Smoked  Shrimps.     It has been well over 14 years since I've eaten stuffed shrimps and it was well worth it and the drive I had three just sitting there in the car mum-mum mum good.....two or three frog legs there mum mum good.........on the drive back my hand was in the bag again for another stuffed shrimp..........................the smoked catfish/ salmon and shrimps were just as good......I'm out south from time to time and will be dropping in for more.  Maybe it's good I didn't know Calumets was there when I lived out south. But I know now.......yes yes yes ............... Boy the Stuffed Shrimps..............

44.description: The full order of fries shrimp was on point. I've also tried the smoked salmon, which was also very good.

24.description: The fried clam strips and smoked shrimp were awesome. The smoked salmon was good... but I much prefer it to be filleted with the bones removed instead of steak cut. It was quite the hike from the western suburbs so I don't see myself going back out there unless I'm super craving those awesome smoked shrimp.

7.description: Tried the smoked shrimp, & I loved it!! :) I cannot wait to come back and try the smoked salmon and lake perch!  Everyone should check Calumet Fisheries out. You won't be disappointed!

49.description: Yes yes yes. 100% love for this place.The service is excellent and family owned.The fish is QUALITY. Don't bother with the fried stuff, just get yourself a slab of the salmon with garlic and pepper. It is life changing.I honestly can't put this place into words, it became one of my favorite Chicago restaurants in the course of one meal.(Disclaimer: Ignore those people who are terrified of anything past Hyde Park. I'm all about safety, but sometimes I think people are too prejudiced against the South Side. This place is definitely worth the "risk.")

40.description: Simple yet most effective way to write this review, this place can be summed up five words and here we go, best shrimp in the city.  Whether you eat it in your car or lucky enough to get one of the picnic tables you will not be disappointed, this is easily a must have, the shrimp is so fresh lightly breaded and just plain awesome, the fries are the perfect complement and the choice of sauces just add to the perfect meal.

53.description: "You guys are driving through the hood? Do you want to borrow my gun?" Our friend in Chicago thought we were nuts to drive all the way there for some smoked fish, but we know it's gonna be so worth it.Salmon with garlic and pepper: so oily yet so tasty! Favorite!White fish: actually our second favorite. Really good flavor.Trout: pretty amazing fish, each section has its own distinct flavor and texture.Smoked Shrimp: awesome.Chubs: FAVORITE!!! But they are seasonal so we didn't have them this visit. We had it 5 years ago, amazing.

30.description: We dropped by last Friday afternoon and all the guys were very friendly. All were helpful and gave us a sample of the salmon. Boy, we were in for a treat! One of the guys (regret not asking his name) explained the sections of the salmon that taste best. He also suggested the eye but we declined; we're not that cool.  Since we had purchased other food before the sample, we did not buy the smoked fish. On Saturday afternoon, my man suggested smoked fish for dinner so here we go again. We ordered the pepper and garlic salmon and the smallest piece of sturgeon. Once we got home, we began with the sturgeon.  We regret buying the smallest sturgeon piece. The sturgeon was perfect! It was not flaky like other fish, it was very soft, flavorful and boneless (at least the section we bought). We bought a bigger piece of salmon and it was delightful. I expected to taste the garlic but I did not; however, we enjoyed it. Frankly, between the sturgeon and salmon, I prefer the sturgeon. The service during both visits was exceptional and we waited a few minutes to place our orders during both visits because there were several people ahead of us.   Knowing my man's eating habits, we will be frequent customers. We've already determined that when family visits in a few weeks, we will be having smoked sturgeon for dinner.

46.description: I had a really great experience at Calumet Fisheries.THE AMBIANCE:Calumet Fisheries is a small seafood shack with an outdoor smoke house. You walk in and pick your food off of a menu on the wall and from the glass counters. It is super small and the venue is meant for you to walk in and order. Outside by the smoke house there are long tables bleacher-style for you to sit and enjoy your pickings.THE FOOD:It was three (3) of us on this food trip and we ordered garlic smoked salmon, garlic smoked trout, fried scallops, fried catfish, and macaroni salad. A thing to note is that they don't have lemons (sigh) and they don't sell beer (double sigh). Lucky for us we had packed some brewskis. We set up food camp on the table and dug in. The seafood, especially the garlic smoked trout, was AMAZING. It was delicious! Calumet Fisheries provides a hot sauce that had a tangy-ness to it. Other than that you might want to bring your favorite hot sauce as well.   The macaroni salad was not good. It had so much mayo. None of us liked it/ate it. Carlos, who works there, came over and talked to us a bit about the history of Calumet Fisheries and he brought us some fresh cooked salmon, which he broke apart in front of us so we could taste some of the most buttery and juicy parts. He is awesome. We also got a tour of the smoke house. Super cool. During our trip the crew of Man Fire Food on the Cooking Channel was there and I got to meet the host, Roger Mooking. Super sweet and down to earth guy.THE TIPS:It can get really hot so wear sunscreen! I would pack some lemons/limes, cold beer, and your fave hot sauce!! Street parking.

1.description: If you're ever in Chicago and want to venture out from the city, this place is definitely worth the trip!! It's location is kind of random but not too hard to find. They only have 1 picnic table to sit at outside so either come prepared to possibly eat standing or come prepared to wait until you get home to eat.Smoked shrimp (10/10) - large shrimp, smoked perfectly with so much flavorSmoked salmon (10/10) - nicely cut, smoked the same way as the shrimpFried oysters (6/10) - I'm not a fan of the texture of fried oysters so this may not be completely accurate but I didn't feel like their fried oysters tasted any different from ones I've had in the pastFried shrimp (8/10) - if you're not a fan of smoked foods, then I would recommend to go with the fried shrimp, medium/large shrimp, fry batter was nice and crispy**They will give tartar sauce and cocktail sauce with your order

55.description: After reading about how Anthony Bourdaine has sponsored this place, I knew I had to stop by. This place is a 30 minute drive from downtown Chicago, so I would not suggest you take a taxi. If you decide to drive here, there is a $7 toll to get there and $7 to back into Chicago. The tolls can be pricey. I decided to stop by on my way home back to Michigan. You can park on the street or turn right into the fishery. Recently, Mark, the owner told me you do not need to take the skyway to get there. You can stay on 94 south.  When it splits with 57, get off on the first exit that will take you right to 95th street turn right and drive 3 miles and your at our door steps. Good tip for us tourist (;The food is completely delicious. I really can not tell you how good this place is. I am still drooling when I think about their smoked pepper garlic salmon & smoked shrimp. Prices can be a bit pricey at $15 per lb for smoked salmon & $22 per lb for smoked shrimp, but it was definitely worth it. The flavors were on point. It was the best smoked fish I have ever had. The shrimp was just amazing! You can truly taste the true flavor of the shrimp. You can even smell the smoke from the shrimp. They do not have cocktail sauce. They have hot sauce and have an amazing tartar sauce. A few flaws are that they do not have a restroom, only take cash, and have only two tables to eat outside. Overall, I cannot wait to come back!

9.description: I had been wanting to stop here when my wife and I flew into Chicago on our way to IN. Now we live in IL and I finally had an opportunity to stop.This place is simply perfect! Great prices for a super quality product! It really is hard deciding what to try when you first walk in. We tried the pepper salmon and the smoked shrimp. Both were heavenly. Next time I am bringing a six pack of good beer and a bigger appetite. Great job to all those that run this place!

26.description: Welp! Not what I was expecting. I have to stop putting faith in seafood that is located in the city and at a low cost. This is mediocre at best. The scallops are not fresh and very chewy. The shrimp are clearly store brought and not fresh. The smoked fish is good, but to be honest. I can get the same quality out of a can of tin fish from the grocery store. The best thing was the cheese bites and that is very sad. If I am in the area and craving some cheese bites and smoked trout. I will make the stop, but other then that. I will stick to Pappadeaux out in the burbs for quality seafood.

25.description: This place is awesome they have young kids working there that have the best attitudes i have ever encountered in a restaurant great food and great service it has such a home feeling.

12.description: This place is good!!! We got fried shrimp, smoked shrimp, fried oysters, fried scallops, and smoked salmon. My husband likes the fried shrimp, I'm not a big fried shrimp person so it as just okay to me! The fried oyster wasn't that good either, I think because it was kinda soggy I don't know. But like earlier reviews the smoked salmon and smoked shrimp is to die for! SERIOUSLY! It's that good! I want to try the black pepper and garlic smoked salmon now and other smoked stuff. The fried stuff is just okay but the smoked seafood here is where it's at!This place is just a little join on the side of the bridge. You order and you get out! But you need to try it, it's good!

59.description: Delicious smoked shrimp and fried scallops that melt in your mouth.

21.description: Get the whitefish you will not be disappointed. The peppered salmon was pretty tasty. The fried shrimp was just okay. The breading had a very course texture.

17.description: Solid 3.5 stars on Calumet fisheries. I stopped by here on the way back from a brewery voyage in Gary and stopped in really quick to grab some fried goodness for my trek back to the north burbs. Decided on the fried shrimp and asked for a recommendation on something else and got the catfish. Catfish was a wee bit too fishy for me, but the shrimp were $$$$. I need to come back and try the smoked salmon and trout, and perhaps the smelts as well. I also thought the cocktail sauce was a bit too sweet for my liking. Not enough bite (horseradish). I also didn't receive fries at all, and realized this as I was too far away to turn back. Oh well, next time, Gadget.

10.description: I've been wanting to check out Calumet Fisheries FOREVER, so I was pretty excited to finally swing by!  This smokehouse has been family-owned and -operated by the Kotlick-Toll family since '48, where the fish is brined overnight and special oak logs are used for the smoking.  Fish, such as catfish, chubs, eel, rainbow trout, sable, salmon, sturgeon, white fish, and herring are some that are available.  They also have fried seafood (shrimp, fish, catfish, scallops, and crab cakes), as well as sides and salads.  I tried their Pepper & Garlic smoked salmon, a half order of the fried shrimp, and a half order of their fried smelts.  The smoked salmon was pretty good; just use a strong fork to flake it apart; they have packages of saltine crackers available, but you can bring you own.  It had a lovely smoked flavor, and the garlic and the peppercorn was not too overpowering.  Just having the fish with the crackers can be a little dry, so having some mayonnaise to spruce it up is a good idea.  The fried shrimp was forgettable, and the fried smelts were okay - the batter was more like ground cornmeal-like, rather than the crispy batter I was expecting.  Service was super friendly, and everything is made fresh-to-order (besides the smoked fish).  This is a cash only joint, so keep that in mind.  It is a carry-out only, but there are a couple of picnic tables in the front to enjoy your meal (I prefer to just chowing down in the car - that's how you do ittttttt) :P  I'd love to come back and try out their smoked sable, sturgeon, and the trout :D+Pepper & Garlic smoked salmon+friendly staff+cash only

5.description: I made an hour trip and the Catfish was bland and tasteless. Also got the fried mac and cheese, it tastes like easy mac. Despite the other raving reviews, I would not recommend or go back

3.description: I came back here after not eating there for a long time, but I was in the middle of running errands and stopped through for a bite. My only issue with them is they don't accept credit cards and they have an ATM machine (strongly advise not using because the owners of the ATM will assess a fee and you'll get charged by you bank also for using the machine). They really do need to get with the the times in terms of how people pay for things. So until they get their payment methods updated where they accept credit cards is to bring cash. I ordered some fish chips and they were pretty good tasting almost identical to the way Lawrences makes their fish chips. Also this place has had the same owner and remained in the same location since 1948. Again they do need to come with the times because Lawrence's Fisheries used to look like Calumet Fisheries, but the family that owns Lawrence's have gotten a website with their menu and the restaurant's history on it and even going as far as taking orders via the site and  expanded by remodeling the restaurant and even expanding with a second location. It's a cute little divey place and will get crowded on certain days preferably Friday and Saturday nights. Everything is cooked fresh to order which is what I like because I like freshly prepared food and not some mess under a hot lamp. There is only one picnic table outside so prepare to eat standing up, in your car or wait until someone leaves to use the table (weather pending). Overall the food is pretty good :-)

35.description: Solid 3.5 stars on Calumet fisheries. I stopped by here on the way back from a brewery voyage in Gary and stopped in really quick to grab some fried goodness for my trek back to the north burbs. Decided on the fried shrimp and asked for a recommendation on something else and got the catfish. Catfish was a wee bit too fishy for me, but the shrimp were $$$$. I need to come back and try the smoked salmon and trout, and perhaps the smelts as well. I also thought the cocktail sauce was a bit too sweet for my liking. Not enough bite (horseradish). I also didn't receive fries at all, and realized this as I was too far away to turn back. Oh well, next time, Gadget.

19.description: It took me toooooooo long to get here and I am only kicking myself!! GREAT no the BEST.... smoked fish I have ever had : )!! YUM. Go now and try it all... bring a cooler and fill it up, trust me!!! Smoked salmon was my favorite. the peel and eat shrimp were also great! Bring Cash...

28.description: I don't recommend this place. The service was rude and the catfish tasted overly fishy and not very fresh.

45.description: Awesome smoked salmon & smoked shrimps!!!Not a fan of their fried oysters, though! But overall, it was great food! :)

33.description: Been going there since I was a kid. Love the fish and chips and shrimp. Don't forget the fries. Mix the hot and mild sauce for the best. They used to have a medium but got rid of it years ago.

43.description: Worth driving out of your way for. Seriously. This was easily a half hour drive outside of Chicago, and I'd do it again. Smoked and fried fish aplenty, right on the water. It really doesn't get much better than this. If my endorsement isn't enough for you, the many awards on the walls should be. Anthony Bourdain is among their fans, too.Smoked is the way to go here. I'm sure their fried fish is fine, and the smelts we tried were tasty, but the smoked fish was by far the star of our meal. They sell by weight, so come hungry and plan to buy a couple of pounds to split with a group. There's some outdoor seating available or you can take it with you, but be sure to bring cash- I'm not a fan of cash-only businesses, but at least there's an ATM here.SMELTS: Grab a half order, available with a spicy or mild dipping sauce not unlike a buffalo wing sauce. They're hot and crispy, and plenty for sharing even with the half order. But I'd take these to go and make a garlic sauce to serve them with, as done in European cuisine.GARLIC PEPPER SMOKED SALMON: This was tasty, and by far the most recommended fish in the reviews. It was good, but not amazing. If your only knowledge of smoked fish is the lox on your bagel at a chain restaurant, you might really like this massive step up in quality.SMOKED TROUT: Go classic. The smoked trout is divine. No pepper or garlic needed, just simple, smoked fish. It's flavorful, with plenty of skin, and I could eat it for days.CRACKERS: Whatever you buy, grab a tube of crackers (they're 55 cents) to eat your fish with.  And don't forget to grab napkins, because you'll be eating all this tastiness with your hands.

2.description: I watched Anthony Bourdain chow down on some seafood here and then found myself in Chicago for a wedding a couple of weeks later. My husband had been in the city shortly before this and demanded that we go to Calumet Fisheries--obviously I had no problem with this!We were all fairly full from brunch earlier in the morning and we were short on time, but we made sure to stop here for some smoked salmon. This. Salmon. It was rich and flavorful and absolutely amazing. I described it at the time as a sort of salmon jerky--kind of like beef jerky in the flavor profile, but obviously not a chewy strip of meat. I'm not acting out when I say this was life changing and I can't wait to go back and feast on more! Tips:Cash onlyKeep an eye out for bones in the fish

18.description: It's hard to go wrong here...the big thing was just committing to make the drive here, but once I got in, I could see why the reviews here are so great.Tried the fried perch, fried catfish, fried clam strips, and the fried shrimp, while others in my party also got the fried oysters.  Besides the fact that I'm surprised I'm still alive and able to write this review, the food was amazing and all of the dinners come with fries so you'll find a way to leave full here for sure.  The space is small and not sexy, and there's nowhere to sit, and it's cash only.  But if you are in the market for smoked fish of almost any type, this is the place to go and between Bourdain showing up here and Calumet being a Beard award finalist a few years ago for being an historic eatery, you know it's legit!

41.description: Happy I finally made a point to drive down here. What a unique place! My family did the smoked salmon, pepper and garlic smoked salmon, and smoked whitefish. The p&g salmon and the whitefish were both standout. We also did the smoked shrimp which were interesting to try (have never had) and were good as well. My brother likes slaw and wasn't impressed by theirs. Good experience though. Happy I've gone at least once and if am in the vicinity will definitely come back

52.description: Anthony Bourdain's show about Chicago prompted my interest in Calumet Fisheries. It turns out that my Southside mother (88th and Mackinaw then Lansing) used to go to this very same place on Fridays in the 1950s when the restaurant served shrimp in Chinese take-out cartons whose sides would become so greasy that people could see through them! Sixty years later on 5/29/2015 my mother ordered the shrimp dinner, which comes with slaw. According to her, the shrimp still have the same coating as back in the '50s! My fiancee and I ordered a large fry (nice thick square-cut fries served in a huge old-fashioned red and white paper ground-beef tray), the smoked trout, smoked salmon with pepper and garlic, and the normal smoked salmon, to which an employee said, "There's nothing normal around here." :-) The salmon just came out of the smoker and had a pleasant oily and tender texture that lacked any trace of smokey flavor. The trout was fine. All three orders of fish came in triple-wrapped white paper, which adds to the great old-fashioned touch. The slaw was nice and tangy. The fries had a full and slightly oily favor that complemented the fish. Overall, there's nothing to criticize! Just enjoy this time-tested Southside treasure of great fishy goodness, especially if are a Chicagoan! Support the local economy, damn it!! PS Tip 1: Some people may be a bit apprehensive about the neighborhood, but they shouldn't worry too much. Just take the Bishop Ford to the Stoney Exit, which takes you on a very long exit ramp that deposits you at about 97th and Stoney. Go a couple blocks north to 95th, make a right, and go 2 short miles to Calumet Fisheries. Tip 2: We completed our Southeast-side tour by eating at some picnic tables at the William Powers State Recreation Area at 126th and Ave. O in the lesser-known Chicago neighborhood Hegewisch. Despite the Rahmfather's official tourist maps that end at 55th street, Chicago does have countless hidden gems south of Hype Park, such as Pullman, Argus Brewery, and Calumet Fisheries! Get in on the secret before the hipsters do!!

50.description: It's hard to go wrong here...the big thing was just committing to make the drive here, but once I got in, I could see why the reviews here are so great.Tried the fried perch, fried catfish, fried clam strips, and the fried shrimp, while others in my party also got the fried oysters.  Besides the fact that I'm surprised I'm still alive and able to write this review, the food was amazing and all of the dinners come with fries so you'll find a way to leave full here for sure.  The space is small and not sexy, and there's nowhere to sit, and it's cash only.  But if you are in the market for smoked fish of almost any type, this is the place to go and between Bourdain showing up here and Calumet being a Beard award finalist a few years ago for being an historic eatery, you know it's legit!

4.description: I had a really great experience at Calumet Fisheries.THE AMBIANCE:Calumet Fisheries is a small seafood shack with an outdoor smoke house. You walk in and pick your food off of a menu on the wall and from the glass counters. It is super small and the venue is meant for you to walk in and order. Outside by the smoke house there are long tables bleacher-style for you to sit and enjoy your pickings.THE FOOD:It was three (3) of us on this food trip and we ordered garlic smoked salmon, garlic smoked trout, fried scallops, fried catfish, and macaroni salad. A thing to note is that they don't have lemons (sigh) and they don't sell beer (double sigh). Lucky for us we had packed some brewskis. We set up food camp on the table and dug in. The seafood, especially the garlic smoked trout, was AMAZING. It was delicious! Calumet Fisheries provides a hot sauce that had a tangy-ness to it. Other than that you might want to bring your favorite hot sauce as well.   The macaroni salad was not good. It had so much mayo. None of us liked it/ate it. Carlos, who works there, came over and talked to us a bit about the history of Calumet Fisheries and he brought us some fresh cooked salmon, which he broke apart in front of us so we could taste some of the most buttery and juicy parts. He is awesome. We also got a tour of the smoke house. Super cool. During our trip the crew of Man Fire Food on the Cooking Channel was there and I got to meet the host, Roger Mooking. Super sweet and down to earth guy.THE TIPS:It can get really hot so wear sunscreen! I would pack some lemons/limes, cold beer, and your fave hot sauce!! Street parking.

6.description: Although the location is a bit odd and out of the way from most of downtown, it's well worth making your journey out. The smoked salmon was amazing and the place just feels like a historical and cultural gem. I can't fully recommend the fish dinner as it's not the salmon and the price was high for what it was. But if you're looking for the best smoked salmon in Chicago, look no further.

22.description: There is always a line in this little jewel but it is so worth the wait!  I remember eating from this restaurant when I was just a little girl - many, many years ago! The fish was always freshly prepared on the spot, hot & delicious. My mom would buy the smelts back then & it would be a special treat.  The food seldom made it home.  It is just as good now as I remember back then.Highly recommended!

15.description: Can someone who is a chicago native tell me if there is a way to get from downtown to this place without paying the toll? because we really didn't go on the bridge we passed the toll, drove like 3 steps ordered our food and U turned to get back to down town... such a waste of a toll. I did my research on yelp before coming here so i had an idea of what i wanted to order, there is no dining inside but there was a few seats outside (chicago is way too cold to eat outdoors in late october eary november imo) the fragrant of smoked fish consumes you as soon as you open the door, this is a small shop with lots of options. As per my fellow yelpers recommendations i ordered the fried scallops, the shrimp and the smoked salmon. The salmon was sooo good! you get a big portion for just a few bucks, i thought it was totally worth it! the smokiness is in every bite and i never had smoked fish before but i am now a fan! The scallops were small but juicy and they don't go cheap on it either, you get alot (they were a bit pricey if you asked me but i am glad i got to try it) the shrimps were HUGE i swear it was like they were on steroids but hey i am NOT complaining.... i am just amazed. There was so much meat in each of these delicious shrimp, i could eat these all day. If i had to come back i would definitely get MORE shrimp and try some of their other smoked pieces of fish... If i was only allowed to chose one item i'd go with SHRIMP!

57.description: nothing beats smoked fish like this place...a small hole in the wall in the middle of nowhere but my oh my, the fish is delicious and fresh.. I wish we had a place like this back home. I could buy by the pound for my weekly sandwiches. No more am I going to be able to enjoy store bought smoked salmon.. Calumet fisheries has raised the bar! By the way, no restrooms.. relieve your duties before coming here..

20.description: Great food, just pricey and doesn't take debit/credit. Smoked shrimp was amazing. Take out only.

36.description: Fried shrimp wasn't the greatest. Breading wasn't great and very greasy. The smoked fish and shrimp was super good! Would go back just don't have the deep fried shrimp, could've been better.

14.description: Yes yes yes. 100% love for this place.The service is excellent and family owned.The fish is QUALITY. Don't bother with the fried stuff, just get yourself a slab of the salmon with garlic and pepper. It is life changing.I honestly can't put this place into words, it became one of my favorite Chicago restaurants in the course of one meal.(Disclaimer: Ignore those people who are terrified of anything past Hyde Park. I'm all about safety, but sometimes I think people are too prejudiced against the South Side. This place is definitely worth the "risk.")

12.description: I've also seen this place growing up (Hienie's is right across the street!) but considering it closes at 1pm, I never had the chance to check it out. But I heard many things about their epic breakfast omelettes and hamburgers. Actually, my sister is fan of their burgers. Mind you, my sister is the sweetest thing that ever graced the planet. And I'm not sayin' that just 'cuz she's my sister! She's got the voice of a butterfly and her kids are more scared of me than they are of her. So, if my sister has COJENES big enough to handle that burger, I figured why not finally give this place a shot....Man oh man, can the food at this place get you some serious hair on your chest! I ordered a Denver omelette (a mountain of what seemed like 6 eggs, cheddar cheese, onions, peppers, tomatoes, and juicy chunks of ham) with a side of some hearty hash browns. I am not lying when I tell you my plate could have easily served three people. I barely consumed a quarter of my plate before I threw in the towel!I can't wait to go back and try other stuff from their menu. I say this because, the crabby Asian lady who served as the cook, waitress, and cashier steered me a clear from ordering an order of french toast with my meal (she was like, "No...No...No...TOO MUCH! You won't even finish it!). My sister says she won't even take custom orders (i.e. no onions, extra cheese, etc.) when people ask for it. She means business, and it shows in her food. p.s. This place gets for 3 stars just because the food was good, but the portions are waaaayy to much for me. I'm sure if I was a trucker, it would get 5 stars!Tip: This place is not good for groups. Don't go with more than three people.

3.description: Food portions are tremendously huge! However, I didn't know the steak was cooked with A1 steak sauce witch I don't eat and wasn't informed of. When I asked for another order, he seemed bothered and irritated. Staff not as friendly.

1.description: After reading the on-line reviews and checking out the pictures posted by Yelpers, me and my official 'Breakfast Hole in the Wall Club Member' ventured out to 103rd and Torrence to check out how Leif's stacks up against our other finds and let's just say it gets 4 thumbs up [mine and hers combined].  Let's start with the ambiance.Unlike the seating/waiting area of our previous visits to neighborhood dives, this one had to be the "coziest."  In terms of space there are 4 booths and about 10 counter stools so don't bring a lot of people to sit down 'cause you might end up standing or taking it out.  But enough of that, let's get to the food.I ordered the Denver Omelette with breakfast potatoes [requested that onion be added to the mix] and my home girl ordered the steak plate with standard [plain] potatoes.  Verdict: Guilty of getting the Itis [both me AND my homie]When the hostess brought our food  we both looked like "WHAT"?  So much food!!  The omelette was phenomenal and she [the chef/cook/owner] cooked the veggies just right so that they weren't raw or mushy from overcooking.  CJ ordered the steak plate and was not disappointed.  We both agree that the potatoes were the best and mine had that extra kick of texture and flavor with the onions added [my Grandmother's style]All in all, go with an empty stomach because you wilt wish you will halfway through the meal.

2.description: If you want the best steak and eggs come down to South Deering! Portions are huge, so you'll get your breakfast and lunch all in one! Staff was so friendly despite some costumers ragging on them. It was a busy day for them and they stayed friendly the whole time. I had the steak and eggs- a must when you visit this restaurant.   enough for two. Boyfriend had French toast-super tasty. They serve you in stylophone plates, which helps you take your leftovers home!

9.description: I have been looking for this place for a few months, found it and I can't stay away. The steak, eggs and potatoes are so flavorful. It's like you cooked it at home with grilled onions. Pretty small place.

10.description: If you wanna walk straight into an early 1970's  "Working Mans Lunch Counter", this is your place!  Inside, it hasn't been TOUCHED in over 30 years, even a broken stool top has never been replaced.  The cast of characters?  Everything from Factory Workers, City Workers, Old People, Families, Pimps, Drug Dealers, Gang Members!  You get it all here and everyone is cool... On to the food--Keep in mind that ONE Woman "Leif" runs the whole joint!  Cooking, Waiting Tables, Register, Carry- Outs.  I can honestly say I've never seen anyone flip a bigger pancake in my life/ definitely an art.  I would venture to say that the flat top in back has probably cooked over 100,000 pancakes!  This place is all about breakfast, Huge portions of everything all made from scratch and loaded up with BUTTER!  Also known for Burgers which are huge (At Least 3/4 LB) and served on white bread?  Meat had great flavor but the condiments were horrible.  Served on a bun with good condiments and this could be mind blowing to say the least..  Definite stop if in this area!  GTFJD

4.description: Seriously really great spot the lady serves you so well I know most people rave about her meats but her pancakes are HUGE and soooooo good! Only thing that sucks is that there hours are hard to figure out but if you're lucky enough to catch them while they are there you'll always wanna come back

6.description: I've been working in the area for a couple weeks.  The proportions are huge and the taste is great.  I got the steak and egg breakfast plate.  The steak had a perfect sear, great flavor and juicy as hell.  Her hash browns were the best I've ever had.  For 14 dollars out the door I see this as a great value.  I am a big dude that loves to eat and I could not finish it.  I'll eat it for lunch as well.  Check it out for sure

15.description: like twista?  well, you might be able to see him eating his steak and eggs here!!  haha!  with his platinum grillz on!  this small diner offers yummy southern cooking without the hospitality.  the grumpy asian lady that owns the place is hilarious and will not hesitate to kick you out if you are out of line.  the prices are great for the amount of food she serves you.  also try her 5 lbs hamburger! just kidding, it's not 5 lbs but it's huge.  =D

0.description: When I say I love this place, I mean I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!! I only wish she was open longer

5.description: Waited months to come back to!  I forgot to mention in my last review don't be turned off by the looks of the place. Yes it's small and a lil cluttered but food is amazing you will not be disappointed. I've only seen the pancakes and they look as big as my head!  The breakfast plates are amazing.  She's closed on Sunday's. Early Saturday mornings aren't to busy. Get here if your in the area!!!!!

13.description: Good greasy spoon with HUGE portions. Mrs. Leif will scold you if you don't finish.

11.description: This place gives huge portions of food, but to say the food is good would be an overstatement. Without a doubt its single handedly contributing to the Chicago obesity problem.However, if you enjoy huge portions of mediocre food this is your place.

8.description: Don't let the crabby old Asian lady scare you away it is apart of her charm. The portions are huge, the food is good and the prices are cheap. You could split your breakfast with someone (the photos do not do it justice). The decor isn't amazing if your fussy but I don't care about that. Ill definitely go back next time I'm in Chicago

14.description: Leif's is a laid back trucking stop type of restaurant. Go there for the food, and leave with a smile. At first glance, the restaurant appears as a family home that was made into small restaurant, which is exactly what it is, but inside you will find some of the best food you have ever had, and they have the newspaper clippings to prove just that; being featured in the Suntimes and Tribune 3 times. The best items on the very small menu are the steak & eggs, and hamburgers, and both are of monstrous proportions. Even in this troubled economy you will find a good deal at Leif's.

7.description: Can't go wrong with a HUGE tasty omelette and some hash browns. At my work, we tend to order from Leif's almost every Saturday. Usually 2 omelettes feed 5 or 6 people. Definitely a great deal for the money.

1.description: This Marshalls is, shall we say, ghetto.  It's always very warm in the store and there's usually a mess near the accessories, toys, and home-wares.  It takes a very long time to check out, mostly because there's one cashier and one other person who could be ringing people up but stands around and distracts the one person who's doing it.  After all that, why do I go back?  Well, there's some gems there.  I've gotten some dress pants and a very nice Michael Kors blazer that I hadn't seen anywhere else.  It's pretty close to where I work, too, so I can squeeze in some lunch time shopping.  It's not the nicest place, but it's a good place to go when you have some flexibility in what you want to buy and you can't get to another neighborhood.

0.description: It's a nice store for emergencies and don't want to drive to the not so near malls.If you go early the place is picked up and  in some sort of order. I go once a month and after the sport season is over and you do get great deals on sports apparel.

3.description: Decent selection... Prices are about average for a jewel... Font make the mistake and think the pricing is the same everywhere

1.description: I generally go to Aldi on 95th street, but the lateness of the hour dictated that I go Jewel which is open a little later.  Of course the food is a little pricey so would it be too much trouble to keep the sale items in stock or at least offer a rain check.  I know because this is a poor community, I can't expect exceptional customer service.  But to treated as poorly as I was this evening.  Bye Felecia.....they won't get me again.  When I got into the check out line, the first thing I noticed was the scowl on the very pretty young cashier's face.  She asked the woman in front of me, "how are you" with a robotic voice and no facial expression and of course no eye contact.  That was the last of the conversation until she asked, "you playing Monopoly", the woman said yes, and the cashier handed her the game tiles without at word.  Now it was my turn. "How are you?"  To which I responded fine, how are you?  No response, she began checking my items with no interaction at all, as if I wasn't there.  When she finished, I swiped my card.  She never looked at me directly,"can I see your card and ID", she looked at the items then dropped them on the belt.  "Sign there".  Still in the robotic voice, and no eye contact.  "You playing Monopoly?"  I responded no ma'am.  She turned and threw items that the bagger had not yet bagged and was on to the next customer.  If I am going to spend $80 on three small bags of groceries, the least I can get is a smile and a thank you for coming.  Can I help you with your bags, have a nice night....something.  As I left the store, only one young man spoke to me and smiled a Have A good Night.  Not enough. Aldi, I apologize for cheating on you.  See you on payday.

2.description: Probably won't be going back there anymore.  Today's event of bad service and attitude problems is the final straw that breaks the camel's back.  The store is always clean and in a very convenient location but the prices are nothing to call home about.  Even still a clean convenient store would have ensured my continual patronage.  Unfortunately the attitude of entitlement and self importance that permeates the staff is no longer tolerable.  In an age where jobs are precious I would think someone would be extra careful to keep their own.  I am the lowest maintenance customer anyone will ever get.  I don' need a greeter or free samples, parking isn't even high-up on my list.  What I will not stand for however is being treated like I should be grateful to be shopping in a Jewel.  The attitude that the store can "take you or leave you"  has cost bigger moguls than Jewel-Osco dearly.  I do not appreciate having a transaction repeatedly interrupted by individuals so that they can all discuss shopping at the local Wal-mart.  I do not wish to hear all about whoever the associates are dating at the time or where they will be hanging out after work. I don't care about baby-daddy issues  and I am most certainly not interested in viewing flirtations and multitudes of sexual harassment.  If you are a fan of housewives of Atlanta this may be a great shopping experience for you. If you like your drama kept inside the television then skip this trip.  The other main issue with this Jewel is that they have a gas station.  A station with less than half the pumps working with the others having credit card machine issues no receipts no credit card acceptance in the store.  Skip that also.  I love to shop local because I know it is my very own neighbors who are employed by local businesses but paying premium prices for sub premium service is unacceptable.

0.description: I use to shop at Jewel-Osco more but the prices is what usually keep me away not the store, service or staff!!I do go though when I see a deal I just can't resist like the .25 a pound potatoes, or the .25 an ear corn...Which was all great and very good!!!I also come to the location to get some of my seasoning that I may not be able to find at other grocery stores like Food for Less or Save-a-lot!!!If you are budget conscious like I am check their sales, bring a coupon and it will be worth the trip!

3.description: Taqueria El Taconcito catered a party that I went to this weekend in Frankfort, IL.  The steak, chicken and pork tacos were excellent.  They grilled the steak on a grill in front of us right at the party and the food was seasoned well and tasty.  The fresh cilantro and pico de gallo was very good.  I took 4 tacos home and they were even good the next day.  I'm going back for more.

1.description: Delicious food and great service. If you're ever craving authentic Mexican food and you're in the area make a trip. The name has changed to La Casita.

2.description: The best Pastor! It cooked on a gyros machine with a pineapple on top!!!! The guacamolera sauce is  my favorite

0.description: The food is really good & authentic.   Prices aren't bad either.

4.description: This place just opened up a couple weeks ago, so I decided to give it a go; as we all know I love tacos.Whenever I try a new taco joint I always order three tacos.  One carne asada (steak), one Pastor (marinated pork), and one more of random meat; in this case barbacoa (steamed beef).It took me a while to get home, I was busy chit-chatting with the owner, so my taco's got a bit soggy, but that's my fault.  I started with the barbacoa taco.  The meat was nicely steamed and most.  I have two beefs with it though (yes pun intended).  The first is that it seemed as if I got the last bits of meat.  Some of the cuts had a lil too much fat on them, which I think could have been trimmed off better.  The second is that a dash of salt would have helped.I moved on to the carne asada.  The meat tasted really good, and the taco was stuffed with meat.  I really enjoyed this taco and it went well with the salsa verde (green hot sauce).Now when I entered, I first noticed that they were preparing a fresh spindle of pastor, so I knew I'd get re-heated meat, but I still decided to go for it because as I watched them preparing the spindle, it looked really tasty.  And let me tell you, it sure was tasty. This was the first time I was able to taste the pineapple (yes they season al pastor with pineapple); and for being reheated the mean was a lot better then I thought it would be.I'm going to give them 3 stars now, but I will be back and I'm sure this ranking will bump to a 4; and I sure hope so considering that they have the latest hours in the hood.  They are open until 11pm on Monday - Thrursday and 1am on Friday and Saturday!!! Awesome!!!Also they have a good variety of meats and foods, and the prices are great.  $1.50 for a taco, $3.50 for a torta, $4.50 for a burrito.  I should also mention that I was surprised to see that in my take-out bag they included limes and cebollitas (baby grilled onions) and a the traditional pickled carrots, onion, chili mix.  Limes are common, the carrot mix rare, but never have I ever seen cebollitas handed out as well.  It was a very pleasant surprise indeed.I'll talk to the owner and see if I can help mold them into a 4 or 5 star restaurant.

1.description: They carry a variety of products from Mizani to Mixed Chicks.  So I'm a fan of that. I usually buy synthetic hair to help spice up my life.  I need to have some variety.  Staff can be hit-or -miss when it comes to helpfulness, knowledge & friendliness.  But I pretty much know what I'm looking for when I get there.

0.description: This is a big blank beauty supply store. I think it has everything that a girl could ever need in here and more. I guess the prices are reasonable for the products and they carry a variety of them. The staff is OK i guess, nothing to be impressed by. I usually go in for what I need and leave.
Lot of stuff in here, selection is good. If you are a person who requires a lot of assistance, this isn't the store for you. It's kind of self service and for me it works

This is a very clean and friendly McDonald's!!!I received my food hot and fast...the young lady that took my order greeted me with a smile!I will go out of my way to go this location even though they aren't the closes one to me!

3.description: Nails were crooked and popped off after a week. When i walked in I was skeptical because of the amount of people in there. The pedicure is the only reason they have 2 stars. They quoted me a higher price then someone that was next to me and the man that did my nails was annoyed when I told him that the nail was crooked. I asked him to fix it and he rolled his eyes and took a deep breath like i was inconveniencing him. Not a place I would return to

1.description: It's all about who services you. The place is nice as a whole but certain ppl are bringing down their stock. Whatever you do, dont let "Henry" do your nails. I went in for a no chip mani, instead of him soaking off the old no chip polish he began drilling it off making my nails thin and brittle, then actually drilling to the point of blood. He filed them down and now every single nail is shaped differently...one even looks like Gumby.Then the very next day my polish was chipped. I went in and complained and he told me he'd fix ONE nail...wtf is ONE nail sposed 2do?! Then once he finally fixed the 3 that had chipped, that same night 2 diff nails chipped. Then all of the nails on my right hand broke due to the thinning. Now both of my hands look a fool and it hasn't even been a full 5 days. Complete waste of money bcuz now I have to get both hands redone. Nvr again

2.description: This nail salon is REALLY GREAT! The staff is very friendly and they do a fabulous job. You can get it all nails,pedicure, no chip, brows, lashes, waxing and much more! It's pretty big, which is good, they can get you in and out fast! If you want a nail tech that knows her craft, ask for Annie, she is amazing. She will take her time and make sure your nails are perfect. She is also very creative so if you like designs she's definitely your tech. Well check it out,you won't be sorry!

0.description: Hannah is the BEST‼ I've been coming to her here for years. She's very attentive, professional, and has an excellent work product. My no chip always last more than two weeks. Note: she's off on Tuesdays.

4.description: Got the no chip and it didn't turn out to look as clean as most other places (I.e smudges of polish). Also, not too sure about the quality of the polishes used. Likely won't be coming back.

3.description: As a local I must say this is the best bar in the area. I absolutely love the old timey feel and how you can just sit at the bar, grab a drink and talk it up with the bartenders. They're so friendly and chances are they'll know you or someone in your family. Prices are great and the shape of the bar is something you rarely see. It's like a big snake!I've been here for events in the little banquet hall and in the bar area for dinner with the family and just to grab a drink with friends. The food is delicious and the music always keeps me entertained. I can't wait to stop in soon on a Friday night to hear some oldies!

1.description: Nice place for a small family party.  I've rented the hall a couple of times already always satisfied.  Carol is great and she takes care of her customers.  I've had the catering from here and the chicken, salad,  Mostacholli,  sausage and bread are delicious. Definitely nice for kids too!

2.description: Came here for the Drina Tamburasi Orchestra concert, which I thoroughly enjoyed. The same cannot be said for the actual Jovial Club.No one greets you when you enter. We had reservations primarily to see the concert and they sat us away from most of the people, which meant that half the night we were twisting in our seats to watch them play to the other area. But that pain doesn't even compare to waiting, and waiting, and waiting for the servers.The tables are numbered and waitresses are divided up to serve their specific numbers. Maybe the memo didn't get through. Our server never came to ask us if she could get us anything, only to snatch up plates/cups and dash away. Any time we wanted to order we had to try and do something to catch her attention. There was another server who kept coming by so we would just tell her what we wanted and she kept telling us she wasn't our server. I guess if we could have seen our server then we wouldn't bug the one who seems to be free.Because everything took so long to be delivered to our table I went up to the bar to order a White Russian. You cut out the middle man, right? Nope. My order was taken and I waited for them to go back to the kitchen and get milk/cream. Another asked me what I wanted and I told them I had ordered already. The milk was found and brought back, sat down on the bar. Another person asked me for my order. Then the first server proceeded to talk with the other bartender and pour drinks for other people. I waited at the bar for at least 5 minutes to get a simple drink when there were only 3 or 4 other people at the bar.The drinks are decent, the food is decent. Everything in decently priced; however, I don't plan on coming here again unless it's for another event like the one I came for. Also, I'm going to vocalize in advance where I'd like to be seated and then order a half dozen drinks at the beginning so I won't have to wait.

5.description: Jovial Club is a great local bar where everyone knows everyone, if not by name, at least by a familar face.  Owner, Helen Spelich, is a feisty 90 year old, still sharp as a tack and knows everything about everyone in the neighborhood, and still walks around to great patrons. The service is relatively slow and the food is expensive for the area, but plentiful and good. The banquet rooms are large enough for private parties and a local Croatian band plays seemingly every month. Good time, even if you don't speak/understand the language.

0.description: I love this tavern, live in downtown chicago but enjoy this small town divey bar. Very cozy!

4.description: I felt like it was 1974 when I was at the Jovial Club and that's not a bad thing. The décor and feel of the place combined with EVERYTHING that played on the jukebox made me feel this way. Feeling like I was in the decade before I was born was....cool and good for a change. I will take pictures the next time I visit.If you're not from the neighborhood you will get stared at as you enter--not in a mean way, just a "huh, people were not used to seeing are here" way. A group of regulars sat at the circular bar and everyone seemed to know each other. I got the shrimp/perch dinner and it was $15 which is expensive for the neighborhood. I'm not sure how much the drinks were since a nice, older gentlemen picked up the tab on those (but I think they are reasonable). Food was plentiful and good.Yep, I like Jovial Club.

3.description: I hate that they close early but ever since I was little I would come here and order my tacos and cheesefries . It's really good !

1.description: Great steak tacos! The meat didn't have much (or any) salt , BUT when you get the cheese, it takes it up several notches, because it's a little sharp. The steak and the chicken torta were just  okay. The extra star comes for the fast service. I was in and out of there in less than 5 minutes, so you can't beat that.

2.description: These were the best tacos I've had in 2015 so far. I came here on a cold winter day because of a craving for authentic Mexican food. When I arrived, the service was friendly, attentive and most importantly fast! The horchata was divine! It definitely had a friendly/family vibe there. Since it's right around the corner, I will be visiting more often!

5.description: I am addicted to their horchata. This is the BEST horchata I have ever had, and I KNOW my horchata, Ive had many.  They should bottle this up right now! The bottled up chemical mess labeled "horchata" sold at Mexican grocery strores is something I wouldnt even offer to my worst enemy.  I have only eaten here once and the food was decent, but I keep on coming back just for horchata.

6.description: Good food at great prices, if you order off the breakfast menu almost everything is 5 or 6 bucks and comes with rice and beans, very nice. Not only is it affordable, the waitresses are friendly and the food is good. Oh yeah they have a grilled chicken they do here that is phenomenal, it is served family style in the middle of the table along with tortillas rice and beans.

7.description: Super great tacos, at a very affordable price.  I came here one day during a teacher institute lunch break, and was really surprised with the quality of food!  It was fairly packed at lunch time, and it was very clean inside.  I will be back here many times during the school year!  Worth the trip down south!

0.description: This place has never let me down!When I'm cold, tired and hungry walking home from the train, I always think to stop here.  They are so inexpensive and FAST it's hard to walk past without getting a quick bite to eat.  And when I say FAST, I mean I order, pay and walk out with my food (usually 3 tacos) in under 10 mins.I started coming here because my dad liked the Al Pastor and he got along with the owners.  He took me here the first week I moved back into the hood.  This is a lil mom and pop shop, so it's nice to keep the money in the community.Since my first visit, they have relocated to the larger building next door which they used rent as a hall, so they have a lot more sitting area, a full bar, and the ambiance is a lot nicer.  I don't know if they still have the ice cream cooler though.No matter what time of day - prime lunch time or off peak right before they close - I get consistently good food.  Which goes to say a lot!  I don't know how they do it, but the meat is always fresh and has that just cooked taste to it.I know a lot of other taqueria's leave the meat in a warming pan or pushed off to the side, which they reheat on order, leaving the meat tuff or dry, but not this place.  The meat is always nice and juicy and hot and doesn't have the reheated taste to it.  Including the Al Pastor (pork & onions), which is another great feat in itself!I'd have to be honest and say that wasn't always the case... at least in the smaller location, but since they've moved I have been completely satisfied.The tacos are average size, with nice generous portions of meat, and of course lettuce, onions and cilantro.  (I actually don't like lettuce on my tacos).Today I had a milanesa (breaded steak) torta.  It was really good.  Not at all greasy.  It was a good cut of meat with just a little bit of fat I couldn't chew.  The breading had a good flavor to it and I think it was a bit crispy on the edges, and the bread was nice and fresh and tasty as well.  I dined in rather the doing take out because I really wanted the chips and salsa.They have a red and green salsa.  They both have a good taste to them and I usually mix them on the chips.I only have two complaints, which don't effect the rating at all.  The first is that they don't serve you the salsas in a bowl, so you have to squeeze it from the bottle onto the chips.  Obviously they are saving money by doing this, because they'd otherwise have to discard any unused salsa in the bowl, but I'm just a big fan of dipping and scooping.Second is that the limes always seem to be a little on the older side; that is they don't seem that juicy.  I don't always use limes, so it's not a big deal, and you can always ask for more if necessary.

4.description: I use to live just a block away from here so it was my place to go when cooking wasn't in my playbook for the day. This place has the best Mexican food (aside from El Guero). I love the enchiladas, burritos and milanesa bistec mmmmmmm.  I have not had a burrito as good as Hacienda's and the enchilads de pollo..... You know what I need to stop.. I'm getting hungry....

3.description: Somebody is playing a joke right? They have got to be kidding putting a BK in the dead smack middle of an already congested parking lot. Somebody forgot to do customer-training seminars with the employees before they opened for business. First, they have the double line drive through which was a total nightmare within itself. Second they person who receives my order was very ghetto and unprofessional, i.e. "Huh, what you say"? It took forever just to receive a simple #2 combo. I think I will gladly pass this establishment up from now on. As they say, you never get another chance to make a first impression. And they blew their first impression for me.

1.description: These people need more than CSR training, food prep training, or a course in product brand dlivery. They seriously need a Health Department Inspection. Even McDonald's 1976 green shamrock shake (better known as the spoiled milk malted), at least looked the part.

2.description: On 4/7/13 I like many others drove though the drive thru.Since 1992 I order the same thing at every Burger King. I ordered a Bacon Double Cheese Burger no pickles and the lady responded back "This isn't Wendy's" keep in mind I've been ordering the same thing for years and though the names have changed for many items they never stopped selling Bacon Double Cheeseburgers.As many of the reviewers have pointed out those who work here are very "ghetto" and need retraining. This is no reason EVER for anyone to be condescending to their customers. Your paid by your employer to do said work but again this is why people refuse to move businesses in the hood or go to a location with a lot of hood employees.This Burger King is owned by the Heartland as a franchise. Ill be looking for a phone number to voice my displeasure with coming to this location.Again, I could have took my money anywhere but I decided to stop in this area.

0.description: I know what you're thinking.  '5 stars? Relax its BK' right? Yes, it's just another BK as far as food goes. I went in for some coffee, today. I left in shock at how cool the staff was. The manager knew customers by name, the entire staff was polite and friendly, and the manager introduced himself. (And not in a weird way, either.lol) This kinda stuff goes a long way in my book. Thanks guys, keep up the good stuff.

4.description: While I agree with Matt Y's comment about putting a BK in the middle of a busy parking lot, overall my experience wasn't that bad.   (the traffic is kinda a bitch though!)  I didn't use the drive thru, and opted to eat inside.  It was clean, and service was much more prompt than I expected.  Inside, they have a plasma TV with the news on, so that was nice to watch before heading back to work!

3.description: Brutal. I'll blame myself for the 3rd try, but it's on the way home & maybe the last time was an aberration.Nope. 2 out of 3 times, I walked out. The busboys do a better job greeting customers. Wasn't busy today, but I sat for an easy 5 min. No one ever came to take my order. I got up and no one noticed. I'm embarrassed I've gotten bamboozled into giving this place a shot. The one time I was able to have a meal, the food was mediocre at best. Customer Service is taken for granted. Surprisingly, it's usually packed when I drive by. Bizarre. It's a shame people have such low standards that they feel they have to eat there. Won't be getting my $ for their overpriced menu. Basura!Take the drive to Tom's. Food is much better & you are treated well. Shame on me for giving this place a chance. Judge a book by its cover in this case.
