1.description: All things being considered equal this place has an extremely rude staff across the board ( I didn't interact with the cooks), I've been coming here for years and the decline has been consistent. They managed to get two stars because the food was prepared quickly and was good. Be prepared for some attitude from the staff but a decent meal and price.

2.description: Terrible from the phone call to place the order to the finished product.  Called to order a pick up breakfast.  Wanted a bacon and cheese skillet but was told I have to order a meat skillet.  I don't want the ham and sausage and so I asked if I could sub mushrooms... No I will have to pay an extra charge of $1 if I want to add this item... It ended up costing 10.50 for a bacon mushroom and cheese skillet.  I asked for over medium eggs and got crispy fried hard eggs.  I ordered two other breakfasts as well and since it was boxed as to go I guess the cooks felt as though it could be slopped into a box and hurry to the next order... Terrible... I called to speak to the manager and I am still awaiting a return call... On day 2 of waiting!!

9.description: nothing against cops but they tend to act like big shot A**holes when they're in a group & they're ALWAYS eating here. It may serve in the restaurant favor however because it is in an extremely dangerous area if south Chicago. Would not suggest anyone to bring a family here. service is also very mediocre.

10.description: Great restaurant in an unlikely spot!  Excellent coffee (also available at the 75th and Exchange location) and excellent food.  We really enjoy the huge omelets - especially the Mexican omelet which is served with superb homemade salsa!  The quality is excellent and the food is consistent.

4.description: good breakfast, everything else is hit or miss. Try it for yourself, you may like it.

6.description: Me and my hubby stop by this Resturant sometimes before he takes me too work they have the best breakfast. And it opens at 5am that's the best.

11.description: This is a fantastic restuarant.  Its a small diner in the Hegwesch area of South Chicago. They have a convenient parking lot. The service is excellent. I went there for breakfast on a Sunday morning. Lots of customers there, but I did not have to wait long at all.  The delicious coffee refills were endless. The menu was excellent with breakfast and lunch!  My sister had the meat lovers omelet.  I had one of the skillet entrees.  The food was in ample portions and delicious!  With all the delicious food and neverending coffee, the check was less than $20!  If you are out in this area, I highly recommend this restaurant.  You will love it!

5.description: Breakfast here is amazing I have tried several places around this area and I haven't found anything better than this one. The food is great the service is even better as soon as you cup is empty you'll get hot coffee right of way. Only downside is parties of 5+ will have a hard time trying to get a table but the wait is worth it.

7.description: Has potential, lots of choices, like purple steer, big menu, very much like a wild west kind of place. Seems like at any moment a person will walk in and try to hold it up though, don't really like that vibe. Lots of food for the amount you pay but some of the soups are gross. And they have this annoying bus boy who laughs fairly often in a high pitched squeal. But all the waitresses are really sweethearts, so it balances.But that is what is fun about diners, and going to them. You can never tell what kind of person will walk in the door. There isn't really any place around like it for miles so you get a "last stop" kind of vibe. So, in conclusion, lots of vibes going on here. I don't like: Tuna melt - ugh dont get this unless you have had a murderous week, or day and need to instantly gain 4lbs, they use American cheese on it, gag. Large uncut brocolli, steamed - got this with a chicken that I would call a C+, but this unseasoned steaming tree knocked it down further. At least a little salt? Lemon? Annoying bus boy laughing like he's a ferret on meth. I do like:Breakfast all dayLarge parking lotHealthy menu that I have not explored.Waitresses are really friendly. Cost effective.

8.description: I only went into this place because Lief doesn't accept anything but cash. It was too nasty out to keep driving around looking for food so we took our chances. I WAS NOT impressed at all and can't say that I will return willingly.

0.description: Food is great. Pancakes are delicious. Chicken Skillet always goes home in doggie bag. Only negative would be wait times for a booth.

12.description: Ok sooooo, been searching high & low for some bomb shredded pork tamales and was told about this spot so I gave it a try. Clean spot on ghetto torrence ave. get in there, order a dozen tamales, $10, not bad. stopped taking credit cards over the holidays but will be restarting it again....... Dont understand that logic but ok. So get the piping hot tamales, asked 4 a plate & got a bowl like container. Break out one in the car and let's just say my search 4 shredded pork tamales in chicago WILL CONTINUE. they lacked flavor as if the pork was overcooked or not seasoned well, it was more sauce & masa than pork, just not up 2 par 4 me. If anyone knows where I can find AUTHENTIC, FLAVORFUL, MOIST, SHREDDED PORK TAMALES, PLEASE LET ME KNOW.

3.description: Excellent deep fried ground beef tacos, always fresh and usually piping hot tamales. Will some day try other stuff but the only way that would happen is if they didn't have either of those items.

1.description: Crispy beef tacos are very, very tasty. Steak tacos are good too. First time. Will return often

2.description: Love this place, but I'm from the neighborhood.  Tamales (pork/red) in high demand on weekends. Try the combination dinner for a taste of a few things. Lengua in salsa verde, excellent. Service is not the fastest but very friendly.

9.description: DAMN..I LOVE THIS PLACE!! Everything is good at a reasonable price. (Crispy Beef Tacos)

10.description: The best tamales in all  the land.  The rojo are moist and flavorful and packed with seasoned beef.  The verde are tender pork with just right amount of heat.  The other items on the menu are just as delicious.  If you live in Evanston it's worth the trip.  Buy two dozen tamales because if there are two of you a dozen will be inhaled on the way home and then you will have some left for later.

4.description: Great Tamales, never ate there before, never tried anything else.  5 stars based only on the tamales.  Green pork and chicken are my favorites.

6.description: I read the reviews and was looking forward to eating lunch from here. I was on hold for 9:51secs. I was on a delivery and had just enough time to pick up. I tried placing an order for pick up, but they seemed to have forgot I was on the phone?  I hope I get a chance to eat here, so that I can give them the 5 stars they seem to deserve.

0.description: This place is definately not closed anymore, reopened at some point, I know because I was just in here Saturday 4/5/14.  I must say I was very impressed because Taco Mex has a unique item that you will not anywhere else, the deep fried taco.  As you will see in my picture below, I ordered 5 tacos, and the three at the bottom of the picture with all the crumbly cheese are three fried tacos, two ground beef ones and a chicken one.  The chicken one is not so great because the meat got dry from the frier, but the beef ones are to die for.  They stick these tacos in frying oil for a short time and they come out tasting like a fried Taquito, then they are topped crumbly Mexican cheese, and are so addictvley good!I also had a steak taco and a steak and cherizo mixed together taco and man was that one good.  The steak taco was boring though, their steak is not that great, but mixed with Cherizo it is bomb!My friend ordered the carnitas with eggs, I had the pleasure of trying his carnitas and they were really really good and juicy.  They do not chop up their carnitas it is a slab of it and really damn good!  The chips and salsa is spicey and pretty good.  I am glad this place reopened because I will be back for more fried tacos and carnitas!

5.description: There deep fried tacos are awesome best around. Only wish you could get there spicy pork in deep fried shells. But very good food.

13.description: Authentic Mexican food. You will feel right at home at Taco Mex.  The owner is very personable, the food is excellent and is prepared fresh daily by the owner himself.  My favorites are Crispy Chicken Tacos, Steak Sopes and Steak Taquitoes.

11.description: Taco Mex, how I love coming here almost every weekend and, when I get the chance to work from home for lunch. The ambiance is non-existent, that is not why I come here. They have the best Mexican around. I always try new restaurants but always complain that we should have went to TM for mexican. Top food choices are: Tamales, crispy taco's, carnita's, workers breakfast, and by far my favorite and the best dish they have.....Chilaquiles you can never go wrong with red or green depending on the hotness you prefer. They only take cash, great coffee with cinnamon, no chips on Sunday. You can bring your own beer in. Overall great food at both locations.

8.description: This restaurant has reviews that make me wonder if I went to the correct restaurant.  So I saw a best of list which had this place on it.  I also hit the yelp page and saw all of the 5-star reviews.  Needless to say I was under the impression that I would have a good meal.  I couldn't have been more wrong.  From the inattentive service to the bland steak taco I thought it couldn't get much worse.  I had two tamales the cheese and jalapeño was just ok and the hot pork was delicious.  It was the ONLY thing good about this restaurant.  We waited at least 10-15 minutes for water and our food took around 40 minutes to come from the kitchen.  We didn't order anything special just tamales and a taco and a burrito.  Now for the reason I absolutely wont return to this restaurant.  Late in our meal our server went to the table next to us which had not been cleaned.  She took a water carafe off the table filled it with ice leaving the water that was left and took it to a new table.  Yuck

14.description: OK, Now you got me started on Mexican food.  Two Items to bring up are both found at Taco-Mex.  Naturally the tacos are outstanding, as is all the other dishes.  But two standout, very distinctly; Tamales and Menudo.  Tamales are excellent. And as many of you already know, they are often filled with different ingrediants.  My two Favorites are the Shredded Pork with Red Chili Sauce and Chihauhau Queso with slices of HOT Jalepeno.  Matter of Fact, there is another Dish my Kids really enjoy its called a Tamale Boat.  Tamale with a Ladle of Hot Carne con Chili and a dollop of Sour Cream.  Oooh!  I'm getting Hungry.  These tamales are INTERNATIONALLY KNOWN.  Some of the Neighborhood  boys are in the Army and the owner made sure they got some in Iraq.My other Favorite Dish is the Sunday Menudo.  If you got drunk the night before, this is the Antidote.  This is a Soup of Cow's stomach cooked in a mixer of Peppers and served with a Large spoonful of Hominy (Crushed they're called  "Grits").  Lime Juice, Onion, and chopped Jalepeno are used as a Garnish.  Have Menudo with a couple of Tamales and you'll kiss away that Hangover in no time.

7.description: Really delicious Tex-Mex Restaurant!  Finally a place in Chicago I can check out.  They've been around for thirty years. They have these crispy beef tacos.

3.description: Their tacos are the best around!!! Once you try them you will only want tacos Nietos! I honestly think there location on 95th street have the best tacos. It's a very small place but don't let that deceive you. The place on 106th street that place has a very tasty caldo de camaron. Good food.

1.description: The tacos are ok but the Gorditas are the best in the area.  Don't forget the avocado salsa, it is the best!  The only thing I didn't like is the fact that it's cash only!

2.description: I will not be going there again. While I was waiting for my take out order, I saw a waitress take a used salsa bowl from a customer's table and transferred the salsa into a new bowl.  All she did was add more salsa in the new bowl. In any case, that is unsanitary. People can get sick. If they reuse salsa, who knows what else have they been doing over there.

5.description: I discovered this place a few months ago. I had driven past a few times and never even noticed the place, but my stepdad told me the place had amazing tacos and took me. I had carne asada tacos, and they instantly became the best steak tacos Ive had around a 50 mile radius (with the exception of the steak tacos in Harry's Long Bar in Blue Island, which are just as good as these). The meat is cooked to perfection, and it is some of the most flavorful, juicy, no nerves beef Ive ever tasted. This is something I cant describe, its something you have to try for yourself. Since then Ive had the following: milanesa torta, (is good), the enchiladas (are ok), the al pastor tacos (are ok) and the chicken flauta dinner, which is delicious because the beans and rice are good, and the flautas are generous and they dont scrimp on toppings, they pile on the sour cream, garnishing cheese and avocado on top. A big plus is that they provide you with lots of pickled carrots n peppers as well as grilled cebollitas or scallions, and the latter is something all other restaurants charge separately for. People think that Pilsen/Little Village area has the best Mexican food in the Chicago area, but thats not true, the only place that can compete, but still dosent come close is El Milagro, which serves up good generous steak tacos.Tacos Nietos is one of my fave spots to eat, it has been consistent every time and the staff is always friendly and accomodating.

6.description: As a world traveler (I've been to Canada three times and Maine once), I'd have to say that this place has the most authentic tacos I've ever had in my life.  I've been to Big Star.  I've been to Antique Taco, La Pasadita, Taco Joint, etc...  Tacos Nietos is my favorite.  I've been to Tacos Nietos close to ten times.  I have six of their business cards.  I have one in my jacket pocket as I type this.  I've also been to Taco Bell.  My favorite thing at Taco Bell is the Baha Beef Chalupa.  It should be yours, too.  Needless to say, Tacos Nietos is my favorite taco spot in Chicago.  Having said that, I'll go ahead and say this: I went there twice in one day once.  Anthony Bourdain would love this place.  Coincidentally, it's on the same street as Calumet Fisheries.  How'd you miss this place Tony?  Come on.  You're better than that.  Please come back to Chicago and check this place out before Guy Fieri does and ruins it for everybody.  Thanks so much.  Shout out to JR, ER and MR for puttin' me on.  One.

7.description: Loved this place.  From what I can tell, this place is in a gas station, but delivers on the taste.

8.description: My very favorite taco place in the whole area. I go here for lunch at least twice a week. They're usually pretty busy, but they're fast!  GREAT tacos, chilaquiles, tortas all in a bunch of varieties. Worth a try! And yep, it's next to a gas station.

0.description: When you walk by, it looks like a taco place attached to a gas station. And when you get closer, you realize, IT IS a taco place attached to a gas station. But this neighborhood teaches you not to judge a book by its cover. The scary guy with a face tattoo is actually a born again Christian youth preacher, trying to pull young gang bangers off the street. A few people I work with rave about this place, so I had to try it.It is really good. Up there with Paco's Tacos. Quick service, delish green salsa, 3 seats facing the pumps. What more do you want, gringo? Come try it. It won't rob you, it just wants to tell you about Jesus.

4.description: Wow what is up with the good reviews?  This place was just ok and nothing better.  It seriously does not meet the standards for excellent CHICAGO Mexican food, and I am shocked because their location on 106th street is some of the most incredible Mexican food I have ever eaten and is on the top of my list, but this location on 95th is bland and just average and a huge yawn.  If you look at my reviews you will see I reviewed the 106th street location today as well and I show pics, now that is some bomb Mexican food here it's just another taco place.This place is attached to a ghetto gas station and thugs, not bums, but thugs beg for change.  this is a rough area to be in but I do not care about that shit, I just wanted you as the reader to get a feel of how the place is, but it does not effect my review.What does effect my review is the food, and the bland and completely tastless Barbacoa taco I had, it just sucked and all I tasted was the other stuff on it and not the meat.  The steak burrito was good but not above average like their other location.  My brother said his 4 tacos blew ass, so yea, we will not be back to this spot, but we adore Tacos Nietos on 106th!

0.description: The other day I took a different route on my way to get gas in Indiana.  Rather then taking the 100th st bridge, I decided to take the 106th st bridge.  On my way I saw a sign advertising tacos two blocks away.  I was pretty excited and took note to try and pay them a visit.Today was that day!  I love tacos and I'm always happy to try a new place.  I stopped by for lunch since I was working from home for a bit and had an empty fridge.It was a short walk to the spot.  When I arrived I was a bit confused.  I then realized that this was a grocery store that sold tacos.  I also noticed that it under new management; I never even knew they where there under old management ;pSo I entered and looked around, and was confused again.  This really is a small place, and there weren't any patrons.  I pretended like I was grocery shopping until I realized the meat counter in the back.  Still pretending to shop I picked up a fresh package of El Milagro tortillas.  Good sign... the best tortillas, and they were fresh.The shop keepers were busying doing thing, so they didn't really pay me much mind.  It was then that I saw the "Se Hace" sign with a list of foods they prepared.  So I asked if they made tacos and placed my order.I ordered two asada (steak) tacos and one pastor (seasoned pork); they didn't have any lengua (beef tongue) even though it was advertised. :(  They they didn't have any lengua I was happy to see that the cook was pulling fresh meat from the meat counter.  I waited as my tacos were freshly prepared for me; which did take some time.Since this is a grocery store there isn't any seating, but I wasn't planning on eating there. I rushed home to enjoy my lunch.  The tortillas were doubled up and the tacos varied in proportions.  I think the asada wasn't measured out equally; that's all.  I ordered my tacos with everything which meant lettuce, tomatoes, onions and cilantro.  All of the ingredients were very fresh!At a glance, on the grocer end of things, they stock your basic staples along with vegetables and dry beans.  The meat counter has asada, pastor, chicharones, chicken and beef milanesa, and possibly more.  They also sell many of the Mexican spices and candies and snacks, along with pan dulce and churros.Overall, I enjoyed the tacos. They had that homemade feeling to them.  I didn't quite care for the cuts of meat; that is they were a bit 'chunky' for my taste... I like my asada and pastor cut in smaller chunks.  I'd definitely go back... for tacos and the occasional corner store grocery run.

29.description: Kick A** chicken here, unless your familiar with the east side I wouldn't recommend coming here at night. That being said the chicken rocks and the sauce has a cult following on this side of town. I buy it by the gallon and put it on EVERYTHING. If your not a chicken kind of guy I feel sorry for you but there are other things on the menu which are still very tasty, the fried shrimp is one of them although make no mistake this place is all about the pollo, so get some and don't forget the sauce!!!!

42.description: Kind of gross fries, interesting sauce and kick-ass chicken. Really kick ass chicken, maybe even the best in the city. Yuuup. And I have certainly partaken in a piece or two of fried chicken.... The chicken is screaming just-fried hot, moist and juicy and the crust/skin is salty, crunchy and great. And the secret to their secret is no secret, it's posted on a handwritten sign on the wall: "To whom it may concern: All Hienie's food is cooked in an animal + vegetable blend of grease. Thank you." No Hienie's - thank you. The sauce is what people usually really go crazy about here - it tastes kind of like a mixture of Frank's Red Hot and mustard, which might be an acquired taste admittedly, but it is pretty tasty - honestly though, the chicken needs very little on it other than my mouth - people buy the sauce here literally by the gallon jug. The fried shrimp is pretty decent, too, and there are always a bunch of people there getting their fix. Basically it's just one of the best things in the whole wide world - a crappy little divey place that is really good at doing what they do. AND that takes cards, too.  Tip o'the day - buy more than you think you could ever eat and eat it there - screaming hot out of the fryer stuff can get soggy on the ride home otherwise.A little side story if you will:I was at a little farmer's market in Schererville, Indiana a few weeks ago (yes, sometimes that is the way I roll...) and there was a stand selling something called something like "Chicago style hot sauce", or something like that, and they pretty much admitted that they basically jacked Hienie's sauce. Admitted it proudly too.  So basically this is some junk on the undercover food-likers dl radar and now I'm telling you too, so enjoy yourselves.

23.description: Ethereal fried chicken quick fried from an angry-looking vat of boiling oil and topped with safety-cone orange colored hot sauce. Try it.

47.description: Big meaty shrimp.....*drools*  These are the best.  I could eat them every day.  One of my favorite places.The place is always busy.  Everything else on the menu is great too.

8.description: Absolutely ridiculous!  The fried chicken is the best I've ever had. Absolutely incredible.  I can't speak for the service as I had these wings at a party but wow. Completely blown away.  I didn't even have any of the sauces on the wings.  I highly recommend!!

31.description: I may have to wear dark glasses to hide would-be attackers after this review but I've got to speak the truth. Ewwww - the chicken was not crispy and super greasy! The fries were soft and flavorless. I tried their shrimp once before and while it was 'fine', I would much rather head over to Calumet Fisheries for my fix. For yummy delicious chicken, pack an overnight bag and trek ALL the way up North (lakeview I think) to Crisp.

34.description: My mom's family is from the South East Side so like many here growing up with Hienie's was a big part of our life.  I still love this place. The chicken and the ocean perch are so good.  If I were to pick a last meal, hienie's chicken and perch would definitely be it!!  I love the orange sauce.  I can drink this sauce straight.

16.description: Sketchy location, but the food is so good.  Who doesn't love some fried chicken and the best hot sauce EVER?!

13.description: This place use to me really good, but it has gone down hill in the last 2 years.  I have gotten sick twice from their food, and I have had to throw it away all together.  The fish was sour and smelled rancid, and the fries were moldy.   I ordered a chicken breast dinner, and the meat tasted freezer burn and old.  I believe they are defrosting it and refreezing it a few times.   I used to love Hienie's.  Unfortunately, I do not enjoy getting food poisoning so I will no longer be going here.  I would advise anyone to smell and check over their food thoroughly before consuming.  Otherwise, you are going to face one horrible stomach ache.

11.description: The fried chicken is freakin amazing!  Crisp delicious skin, and juicy dark meat (if you order dark meat).  Some of the best fried chicken I ever had!  The shrimp is large, crunchy, and fresh.  The sauce is really good and they make it in house.  The downside is the cole slaw is just Kraft.  The fries are alright nothing special but Mcdonalds like.  The biscuits are just Turano buscuits, you can even see them remove them from a Turano package, butter is not included with the dry biscuit.  I really wish this place had home made cole slaw, and at least used pillsbury biscuits that are soft.  O well the main attraction is the chicken and shrimp and that is all they need to blow me away, the side items are just filler items, don't focus on those.

39.description: I was surprised that there were no reviews for Heinie's and that it didn't appear to exist to yelp. This place is a staple on the south east side and it's got to have some of the best chicken. They fry when you order so it's nice and hot. The sauce is great and the fries are pretty good to. You can also get a slice of pizza. It's not bad and I usually get one while I wait for my chicken to get done. They also have daily specials. They're open nice and late so I can make it there after I get off from my second job. Be sure to check them out next time you're that far south.

37.description: Made the drive again.  My previous review stands.  Good chicken, but not necessarily worth the drive.Don't forget to ask for your chicken "old style."

0.description: The chicken and perch is the best in the area.The place might look a little rough but the food is great. I would recommend it to anyone.

38.description: What better place to make my first review for than good ol' Hienie's! Since moving to the East Side, this has become a staple for fried chicken at my house. As it's been noted on here already, as for it "Old Style" and get the staple for hot sauce in the East Side commonly known as "Hienie's hot sauce." The chicken is nicely seasoned and breaded like great fried chicken should be. Well the fries aren't "all-that" but they make a good complement. Oh, and you may want to invest in getting a gallon of that Hienie's hot sauce, it's perfect with their chicken just as it's awesome on pizza and of course chips! All in all, this place is awesome.

27.description: Where can I find something fried in this hood? Answer : "everywhere". Pretty good food though. I just started a new job down the street so I am sure I will be back, but man I wish they had something fresh on the menu. This area is really a food wasteland with mainly trucks driving though and gangbangers running around pulling their pants up. It's a lot like a Harold's chicken type place. Inside, there is an ENORMOUS counter to take your order at and 3 booths to sit in. I got the 1/2 lb of fried shrimp and fries with their hot sauce. I did not know a half lb of shrimp is 5 shrimp. Also, pretty sure their sauce is hot sauce, mayo and mustard. But I ain't tellin. It wasn't bad, the fries were actually pretty good, but just know, every time I check in here, I am gaining 4 lbs of cholesterol in my aorta.

32.description: I'm going to go ahead and get the embarrassing and frightful thing out of the way right now...  I'm not all that big of a fan of Hienie's hot sauce.It's without a doubt unique, flavorful, and probably well-balanced to be considered great- but the mustard flavor of it makes me long for other hot sauces.Let's be clear though- I'm for sure in the minority when it comes to my opinion, because everyone that I've ever talked to about Hienie's hot sauce loves the stuff.*Supposedly Depeche Mode tried out Hienie's chicken and signature hot sauce back in the late '80's and was instantly inspired to write "I Just Can't Get Enough."Despite my 'meh' attitude with their sizzauce, there's no denying Hienie's can fry up a bird with the best of them.  Their dry chicken (unsauced) is about as good as it gets.  Nice crispy crust.  Beautifully tender and juicy flesh.  Comes out piping hot to order.  Just delicious!I implore you all to go ahead and try out this unique sauce of theirs.  You'll probably love the stuff, like the majority of people out there.  One thing's for sure though- even if you don't like the sauce, you'll love the chicken on its own.*This may, or may not be factual.

44.description: Yep Hienie's. 5 stars all the way! I even have one of your tshirts. I'm a huge fan. So unless you've had their hot sauce you'll never understand. I know that Harold's is how Chicago rolls for cheap fried chicken, but that's because Hienie's hasn't whored themselves out to every other street corner. You have to go aaaaalllll the way to the east side. It's worth it. Trust. The chicken is crispy and juicy all at once. I know you're sayin 'Emily, that's to be expected. Why the hell do I have to drive all the way to bufu for some chicken?' Well, it's because of the sauce. The hot sauce here is ridiculous! It's a south east staple that is also killer on Doritos. I'm just sayin. Make sure you also get some scrimps and a slice. All wonderful. OOH - and if you go on Wednesday - it's half price shrimp. HOLLA!Ooh, and Tina B., if you're reading this? This joint should be on the fried chicken crawl.

24.description: I must admit chicken was pretty good. Mild sauce was great. Hit the spot. Will go again.

7.description: Great place for chicken and shrimp. The location itself is not in a good area but the food is outstanding. You can dine in or carry-out. They also offer delivery and have catering as well. The specials they run on a daily basis are very reasonable regarding price. Their delivery service is always on point as well. They take pymt by phone if needed as long as you show your card upon delivery. Tip: not a good place for dining in

40.description: What can I say about the chicken that hasn't already been said?  BUT do get the chicken "Old-Style" and I don't mean the beer. And of course hot sauce too.  Their regular chicken is OK but sometimes can be disappointing.Good shrimp and perch. They now have chicken tenders.They have pizza by the slice or whole. It's pretty decent.On a down note they USED to have some pretty good sandwiches (beef, chicken, fish, etc ...).  But they have disappointed lately.We order from here about twice a month for our fix.  They do deliver too.

30.description: Amazingly Crispy chicken, good pizza, and outstanding hot sauce.  Where's the straw? I can drink the hot sauce by itself.  If your order is large little bit of a wait, but worth it.

46.description: Well what can I say... first of all I can't believe no one has yelped about this place yet.  It is truly a gem of the Eastside.  I grew up on this Hienie's Chicken and hot sauce.  It is a staple to everyone in area.We always order the 'Old Style' whole chicken which is battered and deep fried and served with fries, your choice of potato salad, coleslaw, or macaroni salad, a side of rolls and of course what many of us have renamed "Hienie's Hot Sauce" (Quality Brand Hot Sauce).One of my good friends was in the mood for fried chicken and I knew exactly where to take him. From the minute we called in the order I was excited, I don't know if it was because I was getting Hienie's Chicken or if it was because I was spreading the word about this amazing place.Along with our chicken we purchased a gallon of Quality Brand Hot Sauce for $7 and a 1 liter of Grape Crush.  After equally dividing the food I showed him how we do it.  I poured the hot sauce over a hot crispy drum stick and dug in.  From there it was silence as we smothered our chicken and dipped our fries with the hot sauce washing it down with our cold grape soda.  No chicken I've ever had (except my Abuelita's Puerto Rican Fried Chicken) has ever tasted so good.In a nutshell, get the chicken "Old Style" and be sure to allow about 20 mins for them to cook it.  We made the mistake forgetting to ask for "Old Style" once and weren't too happy.  I'll have to try it again.  The potato salad is probably the best choice of the sides.  And don't forget to call ahead as, they are always busy since everyone loves their chicken.Oh, and get a bottle of hot sauce. It's great on Jay's Potato chips... another South Side/East Side tradition.

1.description: Chicago is a big city!  Today we were in...far south side of the Chi-town, but it's in a freak' remote part of Chicago that I rarely touch her footprint.  In the middle of nowhere, we saw an "angry bird" graffiti.  Yes, it's the logo for Hienie's Shrimp House.  Honestly, whatever we saw really resembled the famous angry bird (lol).  The entire location is very hole-in-the-wall, with a doubled-caged entrance.  Nevertheless, we were hungry, so as much "hood" we were witnessing it wouldn't stop us.  Hubby kindly inquired the young man behind the counter if a credit card would be accepted.  The answer was positive.  Thank you, Lord, because there was no other decent place nearby in the South Deering neighborhood, and I would like to continue my life...We both ordered the Perch dinner ($5.50, Monday's special).  The food came out very fast, within five (5) minutes.  We soon "fled" the area and were well on our way home (I exaggerated...it is an industrial "hood".  Hey, this is Chicago...don't let Al Capone ridicule me, please),  The combo came with about half-pound worth of fried perch, fries, one (1) dinner roll, and coleslaw.  The fried perch was delicious.  They utilized the "blue-collar" breading, meaning that nothing was special about the breading but the taste was down-to-earth yummy.  Ladies and gentlemen, I just made that term up.  Thank you very much.  The hot sauce was very, very spot on!  They offered an abundant amount of food for $5.50.  I know the Big Mac combo in a McDonald's will cost more.  The only minor complaint was the dinner had an awfully large amount of fries and I was mighty thirsty afterward.  Well, that was ok though.  I'm a big kid, and I could bear with that tiny discomfort.  Other than the shadiness I mentioned in the first couple of paragraphs in my review, there was nothing wrong with the joint.  If you're coming from the Indiana and experiencing some sort of hunger on the way back to the city, stop here if you dare.

9.description: I grew up on this place and drive out of my way to come here from Indiana.  Best chicken I've ever had!  I make sure to get it "old style" with hot sauce.  I also buy their "Quality Brand" hot sauce by the gallon from the local Mexican stores and put it on virtually everything.  If I could say 1 thing, their Orland location has much better French fries.  The pizza is also surprisingly above average.  Good job!

26.description: Food is good , workers are polite, Will return and put the word out nice fast food spot.

25.description: Fire! And relatively inexpensive ..the chicken and skrimp are good than a mugg.

12.description: how this crap hole stays in business is beyond me...It would appear that they take extreme pride in employing functional illiterates to service their valued customers....it is now on my official list of places that I will never patronize again.I was shorted on one half of my order and when I brought it to their attention, the kid behind the counter said " I dunno what happened to your food, maybe I give it to someone else"..after searching for my order, it was remade but not without attitude...Well never really liked the place anyway.

21.description: The fried chicken is freakin amazing!  Crisp delicious skin, and juicy dark meat (if you order dark meat).  Some of the best fried chicken I ever had!  The shrimp is large, crunchy, and fresh.  The sauce is really good and they make it in house.  The downside is the cole slaw is just Kraft.  The fries are alright nothing special but Mcdonalds like.  The biscuits are just Turano buscuits, you can even see them remove them from a Turano package, butter is not included with the dry biscuit.  I really wish this place had home made cole slaw, and at least used pillsbury biscuits that are soft.  O well the main attraction is the chicken and shrimp and that is all they need to blow me away, the side items are just filler items, don't focus on those.

17.description: Great chicken.  The old school orange sauce is a must.  An oasis in the neighborhood.

10.description: It was my favorite place to get seafood especially the shrimp. I don't know what they did but it is God-awful. Tried it a few more times only to be disappointed. They lost a long time customer , now I just get my seafood from Calumet Fisheries and Capri's.

5.description: Have not eaten here in a while, due to my move to Dallas.  It came up on my feed.  I love this place.

3.description: I'm from South Deering and I grew up eating here. The chicken is by far the best thing on the menu. It's crispy on the outside and tender and juicy on the inside. Whatever you order, you must try it with the heinies hotsauce. Talk about delicious. This place is small and not the nicest restaurant in the world, but the food is always fresh and yummy.

35.description: Okay, so I grew up eating Hienie's Chicken -- and that is what is was called in the 1970s.I've lived in Cali on and off for around 20 years. A friend of mine used to take a gallon jug of the hot sauce to his family in Cali which they relished like a pot of gold. He'd save some for me - and everyone I let try it thought it was the best they ever had.Now I live north, but when I'm around the south side, I think of ordering Hienie's when I can.A couple of month's ago, I found myself staying with friends on the South/East side who did not have a stocked fridge. So I was gonna order some Hienie's, but I really wanted a salad with my meal. Call me crazy.So I have my friend's teen call and see if they have salad. They hung up on him! I don't know if they thought it was a prank - but how rude! Guess it's funny -- but how rude!I didn't order from them -- because apparently they didn't have any salad to go with the chicken.I just wish that I could find that sauce without having to take a road trip to the south side! Closest thing I can find to it is a hot wings sauce, but it's never quite the same.Still, their chicken rocks -- in any case. But for God's sake, don't ask if they have any salad!

19.description: Shrimp are great !! Hands down! On Wednesday 's they have a shrimp special.. One of the best shrimp I had tasted in a long time !! ENJOY!!

28.description: I hadn't been to this place for years and years. So it was like trying it again for the first time.  It reminds me of your regular Harold's chicken.  I saw this place on TV in which they focused on the shimp. So I decided to check them out based on the TV show.  But after reading the reviews here on Yelp, it seemed that the chicken was the way to go.  I ordered a 2 piece white with the sauce on the side. (my motto: If you can't fry good chicken without putting sauce on it, then it ain't good chicken.)  The chicken didn't taste anything different than what I would get at Harolds. After reading the reviews I thought I was in for a real taste explosion. NOT!  The fries werent all that great. They don't salt the fries after they come out of the fryer. So they were kinda bland.  The thing I do agree with is the mild sauce. It's pretty tasty, and I can see where the affection comes from when the sauce comes into play.  Oh wait a minute, I forgot about the hard ass roll that came with it. Yuk! Gimme Harolds with a couple slices of plain ole white bread.5 wings, mild sauce, salt and pepper please.  Harolds all day long.

45.description: My friend took me here for the first time.  I've never heard of the place, but I guess it is legendary on the east side (been around since 1947). Everything is cooked to order so call ahead!  The chicken out of this place is spec-fricking-tacular.  I guess the way to order it is 'Old Style' (which we did).  The meat was super juicy and awesome and the skin was crisp and tasty (even after sitting in the bag on the drive home!).  Another great reason to go there is the hot sauce!  I had never had it before but it is great!  We had four 1 oz cups with our whole chicken and it was plenty!I'm sure everyone on the south side knows about this place, the place was bustling!  Almost everyone had called ahead the order so there wasn't much waiting.This place is out in the boonies, but if you are in the area, and want to try some of the best fried chicken you've ever had, please don't hesitate to stop by this place, you won't be disappointed!I'm sitting here salivating, remembering the chicken and hot sauce writing this review!

33.description: I. Love. Hienie's! They have the best chicken... dare i say its better than Harold's? The mild sauce is amazing, the chicken is flavorful, the fries are great. Can't go wrong with this place at all!

43.description: Boy this Yelp.com has really made my day.  For many years I always wanted to tell the world about this eatery.  I've seen the 4 reviews and I totally agree.  Hienie's is a well kept Secret on the South and East Side.  The Chavez family is rather huge and grew up in the South Chicago/East Side/South Deering/ Hegewisch Neighborhoods.  I'm the oldest and Hienie's has been around for as long as I've been alive.  At least since 1947.  My Grandfather's restaurant used to be Hienie's competition on Mackinaw.  Hienie's is a stable of LIFE in South Deering, and their Hienie's Hot Sauce has made them famous.  Lent Season is always busy for them.  But then again, it's seems always busy.  The different Fried Fish, Catfish, Lake Perch, Ocean Perch and I think Walleye are also very good.  Try the Fish Combo Dinner, 1/2 lb. of Ocean Perch and 1/2 lb. Shrimp.  Hot sauce comes "ON" or "On the side".  Grab a six-pack from a Liquor Store and head for Calumet Park, due East about 1 1/2 miles, catch a Soccer Game and you will understand what heaven really is.

2.description: Don't get nervous when you see them grab your chicken out of the warmer which looks like a refrigerator. It's the most juiciest, freshes chicken around.

18.description: I grew up on this food as a Sunday after church treat. My personal advice:  buy a jar of thier hot sauce and every once in a while grab some Cool Ranch Doritos and squirt some hot sauce on it.

41.description: I've never heard this place referred to as hienie's shrimp house, only hienie's chicken. Because the chicken is awesome. The neon orange hot sauce is a southside staple. Many a family get together has been fueled by trays, nay, crates of chicken, tasty crinkle fries, a little breaded shrimp and lake perch. If you're ever down here, make this place a priority stop.

4.description: This is a childhood favorite.   I have had a large number of the menu items, never a disappointment.  The signature sauce is the standout here.  It goes well with the seasoning on chicken, fish or any of the other fried treats. A must have!

6.description: This is the best chicken I've ever had in my life. If you like heralds this beat it try their South Chicago mild or hot sauce it is the best. Although it looks ratchet in there its still beats any chicken I have ever had I take all my friends here and they say it is better than Harolds.

22.description: Great Chicken! Great Hot Sauce!Fries? Cold & SoggyInside? A total dump Prices? A bit steep for areaI would def go back just for the chicken & hot sauce/ take it TO GO! Get Dat Did

15.description: Never in my life will I go back here...took almost a half hour till I had to ask where my food was. They said 'we are waiting on your pizza slice'...but gave out 5 to customers after me...then I get the 'well it's busy' & 'I didn't take care of you'...let's put the blame on our co workers shall we? It's nice to know that when you have a half hour for lunch you'll need to spend it waiting for your food here...Zero stars

20.description: I have been here twice to partake in the chicken wings. I must say the batter is nice and crunchy. The chicken was cooked quickly and still hot when I arrived at home. I enjoyed the chicken and the mild sauce was very tangy. The only complaint I have is the chicken could have been fried a little harder. On my second visit, I ordered a slice of pizza as well. The pizza was average. It appears they could have seasoned the pie a bit more. There was an ingredient I could not identify that made the pie slightly bitter.  This establishment offers quick eats at an affordable price. I think the chicken is worth the trip.

36.description: First off. Let me start by saying that Hienie's Shrimp is an INSTITUTION on the Southeast side of Chicago. If you grew up and live here, you think HIENIE'S when you want some good fried chicken or shrimp. Anyone from this area can recall hangout sessions with family or birthday showers or babyshowers all catered by HIENIE'S.The chicken: moist, fresh, and piping hot and fresh out the fryer homemade deliciousness. Golden brown, crisped to perfection, slightly season skin that hugs the tender, juicy meat! A heavenly piece of chicken carcass. The shrimp: plump, crispy shrimp that's battered and fried to PERFECTION. Each piece is ready to be dunked to one of their savory sauces. Another piece of cholesterol heaven. THE PIZZA BY THE SLICE: So delicious. Huge slice. But DEFINITELY get when it's fresh out of the oven. If not, and I quote my co-worker when I say this, "your toilet seat will never forgive you." Don't let them trick you into buying two old slices for the price of one.THE INFAMOUS HIENIE'S HOT SAUCE: Don't be alarmed. It's SUPPOSED to be orange. Just like Hienie's..this sauce is also an institution on the Southeast side! We put it on EVERYTHING: french fries, chips, chicken, pizza, etc. You cannot eat Hienie's without giving your food a bath in Hienie's Hot Sauce. Yummm...(p.s. I'm the creator of a MySpace page that pays homage to Hienie's Hot Sauce...lol)Try this place...IT'S A SOUTH CHICAGO CLASSIC!!

14.description: Great Chicken! Great Hot Sauce!Fries? Cold & SoggyInside? A total dump Prices? A bit steep for areaI would def go back just for the chicken & hot sauce/ take it TO GO! Get Dat Did

1.description: So, I get 2 pairs of glasses plus the exam for $69.95, huh?  Damn, that's too good to be true!  I'm thinking, this has to be bait and switch, bigtime.  And yes, it was.   The catch, you ask?  Well, they will give you 2 pair + the exam for $69.95 but your prescription has to fall into their set of terms.  First off, for the $69.95, you must  be willing to accept single vision with plastic lens.  And get this, the lens will protrude out of the frame, making you look like a classic 1980's nerd if you were to purchase them.   Now, if you want to "modernize" your look, this is where the extra moolah comes in.   Of course they don't mention all of this on the phone, it's all a ploy to get you into the store.   There's also a "protection plan" that you're advised to purchase, geared at separating you from even more money.  Lastly, there's a optional $15.00 special exam fee that supposedly will tell you if you're at risk for diseases and blah blah blah...   Long story short, don't go into this place expecting you'll get 2 pair of glasses for $69.95.  All told, expect to spend over $200.00 - $300.00 in this place.Oh, and the store on 95th street in Chicago is ok.  Very clean and modern with most of the employees being professional.  It was just the bait and switch tactics and the attempted additional add-on fees that turned me off.

0.description: Very professional location!

3.description: Veggie lo mein was awesome but the owner did not give us coke can's coz he did not want to take credit card. Small place

1.description: I think I been to this location at least five times and I can honestly say that some of there foods are a hit or miss. The people at the counter is always a friendly. Its a decent place to go for fast Chinese food.

2.description: This was a pick up order. The chicken fried rice is phenomenal. Pad thai is 7/10 and curry chicken 6/10. Even though I am not giving a very high rating to the food because of my taste I do think it is good quality, it's just that if you compare the curry chicken with a place like golden tai, there is no competition. Would aim for the shrimp fried rice next time!!!!!!!

0.description: Friendly owners and pretty funny! Food is amazing for the price you pay. They had no potstickers but they explained why. Funny reason but I had a smile and left content. I will be back as soon as possible.

4.description: A great place to come for decent Chinese food for lunch time.  All of the lunch specials are about $5 and the portion size is rather large.  Plenty of left overs.Everything is made pretty fresh to order, and because of that, I would recommend calling ahead to put in your order if you are carrying out.  While there are little tables set up so you can dine there, it can get quite cold, since the space is cold, and the door is opening and closing so much (it's busy here during lunch!).

0.description: I really enjoyed this dots the way they had it set up and the customer service was great!!!They greet you when you enter the store!  They ask if there is anything they can do to help you find what you are looking for and that should be a given but all stores don't do that and this one does!This is another one of those disposable clothing stores with a great price point for trends.I mean really who wants to invest their money in trendy clothes that will go out of style in a month or two!!!

1.description: I tried Gusi's today in hopes of finding a replacement to another local pizzeria that has closed a couple years ago. I've heard many rumors that one of the cooks is now working here. I ordered a spinach stuffed pizza for delivery. The pizza got to me fast and warm. The initial presentation of the pizza was nice.  There was a generous layer of red sauce being held in place by a high wall of thick crust.When I served myself a slice I realized that the pizza wasn't as 'stuffed' as I thought it would be for a stuffed pizza.  I actually think that the non-stuffed pizza from all of the other local joints are thicker then their 'stuffed' pizza.The taste of the pizza was overall good, but it was far from the other place.  The taste of the crust was a bit off.  Taste almost like stale crackers.  I think it needed to be a bit thicker or perhaps made with more liquid ingredients.I'll definitely give them another try.  Next time I'll go for the thin crust, which I'm sure will be good.  My advise would be be to ask for double ingredients.  It really seemed about 1/3 the thickness of other stuffed/deep dish pizzas I've had.Oh and for those of you trying to find a replacement for you-know-whose, don't expect too much from this place.  They are different pizzas.

2.description: I ordered the deep dish from this place once and ill probly would never do it agian. Basically it was just a regular thin crust pizza with the crust drastically raised. The taste wasn't great either.  Other than that the regular pizza and the fries were pretty good, nothing to dance about.

0.description: I really enjoyed the pizza at Gusi's! The coupons came last week in the mail and we decided to give them a try. I called and ordered their "Wednesday Special" of 2 Large pizzas  with 1 topping for $13.99! I ordered a pepperoni and a sausage. It came in 30 minutes. That was pretty fast. The cheese was still oozing and the pepperoni was crispy on top just the way I like it. The crust was like a pan style but a little thinner. The sausage my husband says was  "tasty". The nice thing about Gusi's is that if you order a Large you get a FREE 2 liter!!! They also have chicken, buffalo wings, fries and rib tips.Another special is a Medium Pizza with 1 topping, 1 lb. Rib tips and Lg Fries for 15.99!The hours are M - Th 3 pm - 10 pm.Fridays and Saturdays until 11 pm.They take all major credit cards and tip the delivery guy $1 every time to make sure you get a timely response.
It's an OK store... The store is clean and organized, but there needs to be more than one check out person at lunch time.  The line was over eight people long.

1.description: They have some of the saddest, most pathetic "chicken" wings I have ever seen.  Could they be pigeon or Cornish hen wings.  Who knows.

2.description: It's a shame.  I don't know what's up with this location, but I've been to other Shark's and haven't had such bad service.First, there's only two guys working.  Which normaly wouldn't be a problem, however, when you have a line of 7 people waiting on their order.  You might want to get off of your butt and start putting more food down.  Then, the order taker, which I assume is the owner, was not friendly at all.  It seemed as if he was doing me a favor by placing my order.  The young kid in back making the orders seemed to be decent.Apparently, they only make one order at a time.  7 tickets up to be made, several call ins, and they are COOKING 1 order at a time!  I ordered a 3pc wing dinner on my way to play Poker.  Thought I'd be in and out.  WRONG.  It took 30 minutes to leave with my order.  Mind you, there was only one person ahead of me when I placed my order!CHECK YOUR ORDER BEFORE YOU LEAVE!  Ok, we get back in the car heading to the Casino, girlfriend's driving of course, and open up my order and to my suprise there aren't 3 wings but 4 wings.  Ordinarily this would be a pleasant suprise.  Not so, these were 4 of the smallest wings I have ever seen in life!  They looked like chick wings!  No Joke!  The drumstick part had to be no longer than about 1 1/2 in.  My girlfriend wanted to turn around and take them back.  I didn't have the patience to wait another 30 minutes for more subpar cuisine.Never again!

0.description: This place is the reason the south side sucks. All fried crap that tastes the same, terrible. Gross hot sauce. White bread underneath it all. The owner is nice. They have every flavor of Faygo soda, and that is it. Quite gross.
